h4GVo27eZzIIpCCBpA8ehw.text: Yummy quality Mexican food. Love coming here. Everything on the menu is a decent price. Two people could eat for under 30 bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XjJ4UkncMWTtnyPBU4kC4A.text: So this was the best Mexican food I've had since moving to Vegas. Why did friends not bring me here sooner? Why make me suffer through those other awful places I will not name?  I'm taking one star off for slow, slow service and the "meh" margarita. Maybe it was my fault for not upgrading to the Cadillac margarita, but I thought the house would do the trick. It was blended well, don't get me wrong, I appreciate the vitamix type blend job... But alcohol and flavor were lacking.  Now... Food was on point. I thoroughly enjoyed my mole enchiladas. That sauce was as authentic as I've ever had (I'm not Mexican or an expert, but it was darn tasty.) The beans come on a little tostada cup and the rice tasted fresh. Can't remember what my boyfriend had, but he ate the whole thing. Something with green sauce...  Chips were crunchy and not too fragile or greasy. I could eat chips and salsa all day. Our salsa was spicy and I guess I wasn't expecting it because other places had been so bland; it was yummy though!  Will definitely return in the future.

VKTRDyGDdEI22BEjguSI4g.text: I've been coming to this place since 10 years ago ever since it was in its old location in Charleston. It continues to impress me.  The food is fresh and delicious with options on specials.  The staff has always been friendly and the overall quality of this place is off the meter.  The environment of Frank and Fina's cocina is one to embrace.  I recommend this place to anyone who continues to love delicious Mexican food.

G54ORc4LAlTKOes8NLgLnA.text: Love this restaurant! We have been going there for years and the food is always excellent no matter what you order! The staff is really great and make each visit fun and enjoyable. Can't say enough-its all good!!

gJnh2oSBOZPP8hoAgyDnwg.text: The food is great, service is awesome, I love the atmosphere, and the food always seems fresher, and less greasy, than other Mexican food. This place is one of my favorites!

DQW_OeUXRuEjl9qz8IY9Bw.text: I love this little place very friendly staff warm and cute welcome  With good food awesome mojito and chips salsa and guacamole and of corse a finishing touch with the flan

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FwwczYUc_tbCsKkBFMTIWw.text: This is about the best Mexican food in Las Vegas!    The staff is nice and friendly, and the owners are totally involved in the daily operation. Frank is generally interacting with customers and Fina is managing the kitchen.   The recipes are very tasty and will bring you back for more.   I agree that it is a bit more expensive than some other Mexican restaurants, but it's totally worth it.

cZJXqIj9uesR7ZZN1Pvmwg.text: I read the reviews on here and everyone had good things to say so we decided to try this place since it's only a few minutes up the street.  We walk in and it's a very nice simple family looking small mexican restaurant.  It wasn't very busy at all.  We got sat, and someone immediately took our drink order and brought our drinks right away, we received chips and salsa immediately and ordered a small side of quacamole (which was brought out in less then a minute) and had our dinner order taken very quickly.  Everything was fast and great so far.  We received our dinners for the 3 of us in probably 5-7 minutes.  I ordered the enchilada with mole sauce (which was VERY good), my dad ordered the seafood shrimp and crab enchiladas which was rich but very yummy.  Prices were very good too on their menu. Pretty much most of their dinners were right around the $10 range. So for everything I mentioned so far, I'd give this place 4 stars maybe even 5 stars.  But suddenly things completely changed after we received our entrees, (remember the restaurant was not busy at all that night and I think there were only 5 or so other tables dining at the same time as we were)    So after we received our entrees NO server ever came back to the table, our glasses were completely empty, we couldn't even flag someone down til we were completely done.  We finally got a server to refill our drinks.  He then asked us if we wanted dessert. Dessert seemed a bit pricey and everything was $4.50 (almost half the price of the dinner)  So we decided to get a flan and an order of churros (you had a choice of what kind of filling you wanted too.  The choices were cream, chocolate or strawberry) So we chose the cream.  When it came out, it was a small slice of flan and 1 small churro approx 2 - 3 inches in length and a scoop of ice cream FOR $4.25  WHAT A RIP OFF!!!!!!!!!!!  So ok we know next time just stick with dinner and no dessert.  So again we are waiting and waiting and NO server, no anybody to come give us our check.  after 5-7 minutes we finally get our check, and we immediately give him our card to pay.  I want you to keep in mind that again this is a small place and we are sitting right next to a small wall divider by the side station where they get drinks and the open kitchen where they are picking up all the food orders.    After 10 minutes of waiting for our card to be returned, I finally stood up and waived to our server over the wall into the side station and motioned for her to give us our card back so we can pay and leave.  She acknowledged me and then went to the table next to us to greet them and get their drink order. She did not have our card on her and never said anything to us. After another 5 minutes we asked someone else and he finally brought it to us.  I made it very clear to him that dinner was great everything was fast and then the service was horrible and we have literally been starting at the table/wall for 15 minutes just waiting to pay and leave and that is unacceptable.    So... 4 or 5 stars for food and the speedy service to start with 1 star for the lack of service after our food arrives for an avg of 3 stars.    Would I go back again??? YES... dinner and the prices are good, I would never order dessert again and I will not tolerate that slow of poor service after the entrees a 2nd time in a row (there was absolutely no reason for it)

s4J0E3kaf2EHdwrYVVXadQ.text: We went to Frank & Fina's on Saturday night for a Birthday party and I had never heard of it before. But we loved it, the food was great service was great. I had the Shrimp Fina it was amazing and the prices were very affordable.

faEe_TrWPJMKXavmPN54Aw.text: Every time we go we are never disappointed!  The salsa isn't too spicy and I like how the chips aren't too salty.  This time I ordered the steak tampiquena (steak with green peppers & onions and a cheese enchilada and tortillas) $12.95 and the bf ordered a carnitas burrito. The waitress did ask if he wanted anything else in the burrito because it is only a meat burrito with rice/beans/lettuce on the side. $7.50  We also ordered a side of guacamole $3.25, shouldn't have ordered this because my dish came with some.    The food came within 10 mins. My steak dish (medium) was surrounded with enchilada sauce but it didn't matter to me. Also there was a HUGH amount of sour cream.  Other than that everything was yummy! As usual the carnitas were excellent.  However after the food arrived the waitress never came back once to re-fill our water.  That is probably why they aren't getting 5 stars from us.  We have been here many times before and they always took care of us.    Usual we order the charbroiled chicken and the carnitas platter.  Those are both very good!

bhuBx2YRi4YqPflfyRvS_A.text: Chips & salsa were ok, nothing spectacular. I wanted a burrito a la carte and our waitress told us it was the same price as a "meal", no discount. Every Mexican joint I've ever been to has an a la carte menu, apparently they didn't get the news. I had the carne asada burrito and the meat was way over salted. I also found a small bone in my meat and almost cracked a frickin' tooth, no good. My hunny had some vegetarian enchiladas that she liked but they didn't really stand out amongst the competition. Service was pretty lame, our waitress never checked on us once throughout our meal which is unacceptable in my opinion. I don't think we'll be going back here.

VW-C3XC8Y74i-rSKMQFCAA.text: Have been eating here for years and they sometimes have better than average Mexican food. Unfortunately, the food is often very inconsistent. They have excellent chips and salsa, and pretty good enchiladas. They're stingy with the meatballs in the albondigas, and I was pretty ticked off one time a while back at how much they charged me for an extra plate to split an entree with my Mom. So I'll probably continue to eat here on occasion, especially since it's SO close to my house and they do have really good chips and salsa... I just wish their other entree's were consistently good so I could venture out and order something other than the chicken enchiladas with red sauce. IE: last time I had ordered Enchilada Suizas the green sauce had a really bitter, funny taste to it. I know it's been good in the past... so..? Another example, my Mom had a chicken special the very first time I took her there that was recommended by Frank himself and ugh it really was terrible, really dry and borderline inedible. So, now I just order what I generally know I'll like and stick with that, and for that reason I'm sure I'll continue to eat here but also why I really can't rate it as high as I would like to, or what I think they could do if they had better quality control in their kitchen.

WwSEEu15mQat-4wrNbOFsQ.text: Not impressed. The only thing I liked about this restaurant was that Frank himself waited on us and I like family owned businesses. The food sadly is mediocre and nothing to write home about. I was greatly dissapointed in the tortillas served with dinner. They were not homeade and tasted as though they were once frozen and re-warmed. The guacamole was bland and also a let down. The atmosphere was dark (a little too dark) with intimate seating arrangments. The children selections were non impressive either. We will not be returning. Pretty low on the authentic mexican food scale for me.

0bSdGbu1zqoocG-TluyPUw.text: I really use to like this place, but lately not so much. I asked for black beans instead of the refried, and the refried showed up. Then it was $11 for two small tacos. I really didn't believe it, but checked my bill and there it was. Don't think I'll be going back. Very sad. I always wanted this to be my default mexican restaurant for my Slow Carb meal plan in 2012. :(

CaL9FF7_ludhfiUwy2CFCA.text: I cannot believe I have passed this restaurant for years and not seen it!  Four of us  went after a recommendation from a friend.  Service was excellent, as the waitress filled our water glasses, beverages before the were empty, as well as the salsa and chips.  Salsa was good, with a roasted flavor and spicy!  We ordered the pork mole special, chicken mole enchiladas, sweet potato enchiladas and chicken enchiladas.  All had a side of rice, fried plantains, and refried beans in a molded tortilla shell.  The pork and chicken were both extremely tender and the mole was flavorful and tangy.  The sweet potato enchiladas were unique and had great flavor.  My only disappointment is that I haven't discovered this hidden gem sooner! Go!  You won't be disappointed!

ZQHx8CHQJ-IPHbAf5tTauQ.text: My fiance and I frequent this place a lot. Frank is a very nice man, the food is always good, and I love the atmosphere.I have tried something new every time and have not been disappointed yet! Definitely give it a try.

zWH228hhW6lJcw8_lZ23oA.text: Very good food.  While in Vegas, I will eat here again and again.   Service was average at best yet for me the food was well worth the slower service.   Please know coming in the service is slower and please do not expect the world.

S1ScNbzJWqQOelTxMHDZXw.text: Frank and Finas is very good authentic Mexican food, been there twice, both times it was very good. I plan to go there from now on for Mexican dine in. I've tried other Mexican resteraunts in the area and they just don't cut it.    Sincerely, native of New Mexico.

PVnhhatpZ3VnRtVJARXHjg.text: Salsa was basically spaghetti sauce, no heat or discernible flavors. My horchata was the worst I've tried, it tasted extremely watered down and like it was made from powder. However, partner ordered a jamaica drink and his was perfectly fine. We also ordered the pinto bean dip and it was fine. The pico de gallo on top didn't really add anything in terms of flavor.   I ordered the carnitas plate (shredded pork, rice, beans) and my partner ordered the veggie taquitos with black beans. My dish didn't really blow me away, it tasted alright but nothing to gush about. My partner was impressed with his taquitos, which were stuffed with assorted veggies like sweet potatoes and zucchini. I tried a bite and it was indeed good.   This place could be improved, the rice tasted a bit bland and it's one of the few Mexican restaurants in town with vegetarian options. Service was good, our waiter was prompt and polite and our food came out super fast, although we did arrive two hours before closing and there wasn't any wait for tables.

NOGrjI-do-fFCD6L1wYVWQ.text: Im not sure how many times ive gone here! I LOVE IT. I always get the Enchilada plate (one chicken, one sweet potato) I LOVE THE SWEET POTATO ENCHILADA...Delicious. I can never leave the place without getting the coconut flan! Best flan ive ever had! Food comes very quickly. Im in and out within 20 minutes!

s7s638bkqen-Z3tGy3prqQ.text: I was so thrilled to find this restaurant, thanks fellow Yelpers! My gf is from the Yucatan and she hadn't ever found any place in Vegas that has food from there. So I took her here hoping that she would like it as I saw they had a few dishes that looked authentic. It turned out she really enjoyed it! She was really surprised to see that they had some food from her area. She ordered the panuchos which of course I had to try and they were really awesome. I had the house special enchiladas with a verde sauce and crema and they were really delicious. I don't often order stuff with verde sauce as I prefer the red, but these really are special. The sides were all good and the prices right! Only little thing I'll mention on the downside is the lighting. I can't remember complaining about lighting before, but this place was definitely on the dark side. We sat in the middle which was kind of dark so I wanted to maybe move to a booth, but that was super dark so we stayed at our table. Certainly not enough to stop me from coming back, maybe next time we'll bring a candle. :)

i2GoH6frinLCFcN2Na-hhw.text: Been a fan of this place since thier Charleston location (wish it was still open).  Food is great, service can be spotty though.   I don't like that fact that you get small scope of beans and rice in a tiny corn tortilla bowl.  I assume they do this because most poeple don't eat the beans and rice so it is more cost effective not to serve large amounts.

2EuzlE9xEpEWPD2V8bk8eA.text: I've been here a couple of times.  i wish i could come here more often.   It's very good homemade mexican food, but it's not too mexican which i like.   i love this place because it's like a hole in the wall from the outside. but when you go in, it's very cute.   i think this would be a cute place to go out on a date.  very quiet and small. and most importantly it's clean.  [which is not True for most mexican restaurants]  i've had the salmon salad every time. i know it's really not mexican food, but it's SO yummmy.   this is owned and run by a local family.  i've heard that the parents own the one on sahara, and the son owns this location. and i'm all about support local businesses.   try this place at least once!

efk9QjVZg9AipMspzF1FFA.text: This is my FAVORITE place to eat in the entire world. Literally. I have never been disappointed with anything, the staff are some of the nicest people I've ever met and they always remember us and our favorite orders. I'm vegan and they ALWAYS remember/know I am going to ask for no dairy on the great vegetarian dishes they offer. You never have to wait long for your food and it tastes like authentic real Mexican/Yucatan food. We make it a point to eat there at least once a week and now that I have moved to LA I miss this restaurant so much! It quite literally is THE BEST Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Love ya Frank!

L8hREKYcgv9WobdkK2YFQg.text: I love this place, for a light meal I have the small toastata... Delicious

YI5dZlWBUmUIb70xElGbTw.text: The service was spot on!!! My boyfriend and I both had beef enchilladas. We both ordered the lunch special but my boyfriend wanted to add one more al la carte and the server recommended us a combo menu that would save us a couple of extra bucks. Amazing food and service! Definitely will be back!

v1qXMTwbsLJDGnyTgBrAOw.text: Yes! A good margarita so close to home!  Came here for the first time on Mother's Day, was expecting a wait but since it was just 2 of us we only had to wait about 5 minutes.  We were seated and I've heard great things about the tamarind margaritas so we started with a round of that.  We were given chips and salsa and margaritas were served.  These tamarind margaritas were the best I've had.  I've had good margaritas and bad margaritas but this was my first tamarind margarita.  It was a perfect combination of sour, sweet and smokey.  I didn't know what to order for my entree so the server recommended the special of the day, chicken enchilada with creamy mushroom sauce.  I don't usually order enchiladas but I love mushrooms so I gave it a try.  When the food came out, my meal was delicious!  The creamy, rich mushroom sauce definitely made the meal and complimented everything else on the plate.  I will definitely come back for the drinks, food and friendly service.

Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas with mushroom cream sauce (special of the day)

Ic_2oW17cThdFy646hEHnw.text: Checked out this place for lunch. The chips and salsa was just okay. Service was great and food was okay.

OocaTjy59GmR3EmsreaNRg.text: Had lunch at Frank & Fina's with some friends on a weekend.  To start, we had the chips and salsa with an order of queso fundido.  The chips needed salt, the salsa was thin but had good flavor.  It was a typical restaurant salsa.  The queso fundido was a large portion with lots of peppers on top.  It comes with your choice of flour or corn tortillas.  It's a little difficult to get out of the bowl, we all had to use a knife, fork or our hands.  This can occur with this dish.  Despite the issues, it was a good version of queso fundido.  To eat, I had the Tampiquena, a thin ribeye steak COVERED in peppers and onions.  You can barely see the steak there is so much vegetation.  It is served with rice, beans, a cheese enchilada and your choice of flour or corn tortillas.  It's quite a lot of food for $13.95.  The steak is seasoned very well as are the vegetables.  I highly recommend taking some bites with the enchilada.  The steak is very thin, so I don't know that it can be cooked to medium rare, but even thought it was cooked more than I typically like, it was juicy.  This is a fantastic, and very filling meal, and one I will absolutely order again.  Service was attentive.  We had a nice long lunch and required lots of refills and they were brought promptly.  Also, we talked for a bit after we ate, and the staff never made us feel like we were overstaying our welcome.

Jm6kByqUHgHVMkbcwvz50g.text: BEST MEXICAN PLACE AROUND!!! I've been coming here for 4 years and I don't know why it's taken me this long to write a review. The service is always excellent just like their food. This place might be the only reason keeping me here in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas with flour tortillas, rice, beans, cheese, and guac!
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 chicken enchiladas with green sauce, rice, beans, and sour cream
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chips and salsa around!

-qzNd38uRcxT0dBDZWUQTw.text: Sweet potato enchiladas  What more can I say. They are amazing. The food is fresh. It's been a while since I've been here. I use to come here in 2007 and somehow forgot about I.   Yummy

oFDf9AXNvK1-Wlgw_LG2qA.text: Service and food is excellent. The food has such good flavor.  I had crab enchiladas and it was excellent.  We made reservations for New Year's Eve because we knew it would be busy. Every Time we come here it is excellent

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good family atmosphere and they have wine on the menu
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab enchiladas were delicious

R6xxCmBJFefuAtigVNq-hA.text: Being from Kansas where a good, authentic Mexican restaurant is on nearly every street, and being of Mexican heritage, I always like to stop into local restaurants on vacations to see what locals have to offer. Stopping into this establishment was for sure worth it.  The atmosphere was great, a nice open floor setting with high ceilings that made the room feel very welcoming. The decor was very traditional and quite pleasant, not too distracting from the main attraction; obviously the delicious food.   I tried a combination platter, that of a chicken enchilada and a chicken tamal, and I was quite impressed! Unlike many restaurants that serve tamales, the Mesa didn't overpower the meat and was really quite scrumptious! The chicken used was delectable as well, perfectly seasoned and the rice and beans accompanying the platter were just as great!   The only downside to the trip was the service, while the  wait staff was sincerely accommodating and helpful, I felt that they were a little slow in helping our party of four. I will note that there were quite a few people in the restaurant, so I can understand why they may have been running a bit behind.   All in all, a wonderful authentic experience that I would definitely come back to!

F4FyC3IcH9jNLPLpITO7VA.text: Cucumber margarita-falls flat, really nothing special have had better   Chips and salsa-good chips. wish they had more flavorful salsa  Mole enchiladas-pretty good. Nothing to special again   Used to go to this place a long time ago and I remember it being a lot better than it is now. Sort of a bummer

IRDEwb0LffO-dsgqF1ci5Q.text: Frank and Fina's is equal parts delicious and adorable.   This place is just so cute! I love everything about how it looks in here - the lighting, the high ceilings, the decor. It's just a very nice atmosphere to have a reasonably priced delicious meal while experiencing excellent service.   It is locally owned and operated which makes my heart sing. When I say locally operated I mean it! Most likely it will be Frank taking your order and delivering your tasty meal. The service here is very family friendly. We have taken our daughter (11 months) and they were very complimentary and accommodating.   The food is very good! I absolutely love the sweet potato enchiladas. Also excellent are the chicken enchiladas and chicken tamale. I also really love the salsa here and have tried most of the starters. All yummy! You really can't go wrong!

75ipiJOJ2UfzNxnLrnfTlw.text: Folks, there's a reason why this establishment had to add on.  Best salsa in town imo.  Service is always fast and the food...your dollar goes a long way.  Very convenient off the 215.

P6-9zImVoeMLIxHxtsrAFA.text: Frank and Fina's Cocina has been my favorite restaurant since they were a quaint little place on Charleston. Now located in the southwest, it is the only place I will trek across town to dine on a regular basis.  One thing that makes this place outstanding is their accommodations for vegetarians. In addition to having an extensive vegetarian menu with everything from "Build Your Own Entree" (from a selection of tacos, tamales, and enchiladas) to SOYRIZO tacos, each day they have a new vegetarian special. If you ever see the Mexican Lasagna on the menu, get it! Think: enchiladas but with a more tomato based sauce and covered in mozzarella.  Also, I was pleased to see that their glorious sweet potato enchiladas (once a special item only) now have their own spot on the daily menu. Besides that, their complimentary chips and salsa (up to 2 per table, I believe) are always on point. Plus, as a self-proclaimed guacamole snob, I can say without a doubt that theirs is top notch--- chunky and fresh and delicious. While I'm usually too stuffed to even fathom dessert, I know they have several options, including a vegan cheesecake.  Another reason I adore this place is the service. I see the same crew nearly every time I go in (Frank himself often serving tables), and it helps make the place seem homey and comfortable, despite being a huge restaurant in a commercial area. One thing worth noting is that F&F's may not (easily) split your check if you're dining with a group, so be sure to plan in advance. Also, when they give you the check, I believe you need to walk it to the cashier by the door (rather than having your server pick it up/cash you out).  I can not rate this place higher and recommend it to everyone. It continues to be my favorite restaurant of all time, and I'll forever follow their delicious vegetarian-friendly delights.

Ufm0urtCrJ-NvcZKwXpeVg.text: Just finished lunch here.  The food was fantastic!!  I had the chicken verde.  The portion was large, the beans were fantastic, the rice was perfect.    The service was fantastic.  Our waiter was prompt and on top of drink refills (a pet peeve of mine).    I'll definitely come here again

KQXCndJVHy2A8fI1stjzNQ.text: Very good Mexican restaurant , will come again. Good service, Carlos our waiter was very good.  I would come again and ask for him to server us.

WjkJet_0wjy2NX91FoCr5g.text: The fiance had a conversation with his  coworkers about their favorite food spots and this came up a few times. I've heard of it, but we're not around this area often, but decided to head down. I've been looking for some new Mexican eateries.   The food is more Yucatan region judging from some of their menu offerings and the way they cook their staples. It's a bit different from what I'm used to, but I liked it.   I got a combo of chicken tamales and chicken enchiladas (which comes with red sauce but I asked for green) and the fiance got cheese enchilada and chicken tamale. The tamale was stuffed with chicken and had a tomato sauce over it. I think I prefer a bit more masa, but this was quality. Enchilada also was plentiful with chicken in it and I enjoyed their green sauce. The beans is more pureed than what I do and had a interesting roasty flavor about it. Rice was standard, but good.  The service was friendly and good. We both appreciated that we were able to sub minor things in our combo with no problems. We were checked on often and drinks were refilled.We came at not a busy time, and in the areas where people weren't sitting, some of the staff were doing some cleaning and prepping before dinner. Definitely appreciate a place that is cleaning daily.  I'll definitely be back. It's not the style of Mexican food I grew up with, but it's nice to shake it up sometimes. I'll try something that is more Yucatan like the panuchos next time.

KYFZTZb5wj8KizqxHY4rIQ.text: Been here a couple of times and have neglected to review until now (thanks, daily rehearsals!!).  Both visits resulted in happy tummies, assisted by friendly and helpful waitstaff.  All dishes sampled were tasty and flavourful without being greasy.  On my last visit, I enjoyed the huevos and chorizo (scrambled eggs and sausage) immensely -- spicy, filling, and yummy.  Portions are generous and the chips and salsa appetizer (gratis) help to stave hunger pangs while waiting for your meal.  The salsa could be a little bit spicier, but it tasted fresh and tomato-y.    The decor has an intimate feel to it: dim lighting and understated wall art (nothing gaudy or over-the-top).  I would enjoy a dinner here on a date night.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chickeny goodness
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos and chorizo, rice, refried beans, pico de gallo

SJYXJFDRyJd5z68SKGUsmA.text: The food is amazing. I have been a few times and have had the pleasure of being served by Charlie. I have never been disappointed with anything he's recommended. Alexis is always smiling and asks us did we enjoy our visit. The staff just makes this such a welcoming place to enjoy a delicious meal.

9lMQLZiCDYmmkBZEOKrYkQ.text: Service has gone a bit down hill since Frank has been absent. Waitresses don't come back to refill drinks or ask how your meal is going as often as they used to. Service is slow, the waitstaff seem unhappy, and the hostess stays behind her little counter and doesn't bring your bill or come back to run your credit card. We miss the old Frank n Fina's.

Aogukewz93Dl24yWUsyx2w.text: My cousin raves about this place so we finally came to check it out. It is a cute little restaurant. Chips and salsa are good...but I mean how can any mexican restaurant get that part wrong right? I decided to get a bean and cheese burrito enchilada style and a cup of fideo soup. The enchilada sauce was ok. Definitely have had better. The bean's and rice were flavored nicely.The soup lacked flavor and was oily. Not my favorite. I also got horchata ( I always have to order it at every mexican restaurant I go too) it was good but extremely sweet. Like it had either been sitting too long or hasn't been stirred. We shared fried ice cream. Which was also delicious no complaints there. Overall it was satisfying but probably not my top pick to come eat when I am craving mexican food.  The prices aren't bad eitheer and they have a nice selection for their lunch menu.

mQ2fK16NPkMhoRGKEXBMPg.text: AWESOME & YUMMY... Place is small, quiet & great customer service! We visit here often because it's close to home! Never disappointed.. **the Cadillac Margarita is a must Have

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small, Quiet, great customer service!! house Cadillac Margarita  a must.. Me &amp; my Hubby are always FULL &amp; HAPPY ..
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DELICIOUS..

-_VjSlmWVL8t8FRCWKrKFw.text: Fastest service I've ever received!!! Food is the bomb!!!! And the server is amazing wish I would've got his name but sweetest man ever! This will be my new go to Mexican spot forsure. Thank you frank and finas!!!

2zOMmaYcFClMW6tl2ti6mg.text: Love this place......the food is always great and good quality. Always good friendly service. If you love Mexican food you will not be disappointed!

12qj5lZccftVM96OfwtCig.text: Our first choice was kilroy's for a burger, they had a sign saying kitchen closed till further notice ? Anyway, decided to ck out out Frank & Fina's for our burger craving, jus kidding I know Mexican .  I had the special which was choice of two tamales , I chose the colorado and the chix mole tamale. The colorado was good but the flavors of the chix mole drowned out the colorado tamale . The mole sauce was deeply flavored u could taste the chocolate.  I'm jus begining to appreciate mole, before could not stand it now that I know the skill and many ingredients that make a mole I'm a fan . I also had to try the sweet potato enchilada, based on other yelpers recomendations, and besides I  luv sweet potato . The idea is promising , I did not care for the red sauce , IMHO  it was better suited for a savory enchilada . I like sweet potato w/ vanilla sauce or a caramel sauce like other places serve their sweet potato fries .  I think it would b great with their chocolaty flavored mole sauce just drizzled, not drenched.   Chocolate and sweet potato , I think it would b a winner, maybe next time I'll ask, u should too ;). The plating was nice not just thrown on hap hazardly. Rice and beans were good not dry or crusty. Chips and salsa alright , nothing special . I don't know what took us so long to go back last time we went they were on charlston blvd, over 5 years ago, I promise we won't wait that long again .

9dbZ2dNo2_aBI7FfHAAIgw.text: Best chips and salsa in town! The chicken Taquitos are AWESOME!!! Always a friendly staff when we go.. I'm a HUGE guacamole fan and this place just doesn't meet the mark... Clean and nicely decorated.. I always take friends and family there for good Mexican food! Good spot for large groups or families with kids! The food comes out fast, and if you're on a diet, they'll make it however you request it!

RRzu-MkLBHXk2QqM5d06-g.text: Went here after searching for a decent mexican restaurant on on this side of town, and decided to try this place....Service was good, fresh brewed iced tea was good, but that was it! The chicken enchiladas I ordered weren't good, chicken had no flavor, and the chicken tamale was gross, it didn't even taste like a mexican tamale.... Next time I will go to a hole in the wall place because that's where you will get a very great meal on the east side of town.

6LZPCgLQUdc_Q9sBqNFPDw.text: This is place should not boast Mexican, authentic food. So many people had told be to come here for great Mexican food, and so I finally did. I was extremely disappointed. The food here is Tex-Mex, at best. You can expect to get blobs of sour cream and cheddar cheese to top your cumin-tasting "Mexican" rice. The salsas were watery and dumbed-down. Again, very inauthentic. I ordered Carne Asada tacos, which are difficult to mess up in most places (though this "dish" does not really exist in Mexico). The seasonings were off and the cheese was unnecessary. The Cochinita Pibil tacos were okay, which is why I am giving the place one star. The decor is as tacky as one would expect in Las Vegas, and the lighting is even annoying. I would never come back here. i would be better off eating at Roberto's Taco Shop! They are equally disgusting, though the latter is cheaper! However, if you are not looking for authentic Mexican food, but actually the dumbed-down, sour cream and cheddar topped version, you definitely will enjoy this place. The staff is also very friendly, which is why I am giving the place another star.

hdBdY6HnYCx7KzSOUQhH4w.text: Our favorite Mexican restaurant in town!! Mu personal favorite dish is their chicken enchiladas size, their green sauce is to die for!! Also, we love the chips and salsa, its addicting! We always get a big tub of it to-go if we're having a party or something.

8mz5wO2UM6Ywe03pSTj5SA.text: We came here for dinner and a meeting on a Monday night. Staff was very friendly. Sat us immediately and offered drinks. Brought those with chips and salsa quickly.  They have a decent import beer selection and tequila options for not having a full bar. I got the Shrimp Fina. When I think of homemade Mexican food, this is exactly what I have in mind! The sauce was rich and flavorful. Plenty of shrimp and a good assortment of veggies. I couldn't stop soaking up that sauce with the tortillas.   My wife got a burrito plate. I find it weird that it only comes with meat inside of the tortilla. Everything else is extra (cheese, pico, sour cream, beans...) But it was delicious. Overall it was a really good experience and we will certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito Plate with Carne Asada
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Fina

0ldMdqpR0u00npBfOHX7Yw.text: Favorite Mexican restaurant, by far. We moved from the bay area a few years ago, and struggled to find good Mexican. We wanted a sit down restaurant, not a burrito joint. Found F&F's on Yelp, tried it, and fell absolutely in love the first time. We eat here at least twice a month, sometimes more often. We've tried many different options, but consistently go back to the chicken enchiladas and tacos. Carnitas are tender and ultra flavorful. Chips are always fresh and warm, salsa is always amazing. They have a nice selection of wines and liquors, and while they don't have any kind of specialty bartender, the drinks are always great. Nothing fancy, just reliable. We take all of our out of town guests here, and they all rave about it. They have a few delicious vegetarian options, and their breakfast is great. We even had our rehearsal dinner here before our wedding.

orvamK-1cnUMCjcSnVaWsw.text: This place was completely deserted when we came in, I mean it was a complete ghost town. There was one person. They claim that their business is family owned but it's probably because nobody wants to buy it off of them. Their food was absolute crap.

lxX3fJc9vlETpT9Y9cl7oQ.text: The complementary chips and salsa is so good. I had the sweet Sweet Potato Enchiladas, my daughter created her own veggie taco with Guacamole and Pico De Gallo, my husband and son had the Carne Asada plate, the youngest had Nachos. Overall, the food was good and the service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ate here for the first time tonight.

Fxk-PJ2a6A-ngpiZFdjl6Q.text: I got the lunch special: Chicken Taquitos. Nice and crispy corn tortillas topped with cheese, guacamole and sour cream. Their chips and salsa is very tasty too. It's a good spot to take your coworker, friends or family for a special treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G8Og1PsS0ARPt3xe-LDz_A.text: Held our wedding dinner here. Staff was very accommodating & friendly during the dinner & even on the phone when I made reservations. Food was amazing! That's why we chose to have it here. Everyone was talking about how great it was. I personally had the cochinita pibil which was hands down the best dish I've had there. They have a good size vegetarian menu. I recommend the veggie empanadas  This is one of my favorite restaurants.

W4v4rgHyDn72Z1_KnoMSqQ.text: Sorry to knock your rating down, but I've been here about 3-4 times since my first review and you guys are just not consistent. Sometimes the food is good, and other times it's like there's a brand new chef. Last visit we had stale chips, watered down horchata and a waiter that never came back to our table. I won't be back.

6vDhn7GNWtAuS5BKtZKuOw.text: I'm supper shy on giving reviews but I like the atmosphere of this place (first-time) but I need more seasoning at my rib-eye for next time. And I love flans I thought my coconut flan had actually coconut inside/mixed on the flan but it was good and also the guacamole need more lemons but besides of my pickiness  everything else was really good. Definitely love the beef taquitos.

Z5nCpOWUhIEg8wtDoyRXuQ.text: Only been here twice. The food is really good, the service is friendly and fast and the price is on point!

gxE4Bo2NpjcvqXNNvAlKiw.text: Thank you again for your excellent food, customer service and authentic ambience. Thank you Carlos for great service! I had the chicken enchiladas mole which were great.

L2JkvNvmiGWUd-OoObi7RA.text: My husband and I came here and got 2 combo plates. Service is great. Our drinks never got below half full and the food was great.

lkDW41AyYyrq4NMfeLaZJw.text: Solid 4.5 stars.  This place is quite legit. Lovely ambiance, perfect for a date night or intimate group party. The servers were very polite, and maybe not too much on top of their game, but, very kind and sweet.   The chips were by far one of the best I've had in a while. The salsa is average, but with the habanero sauce mixed in, it made it amazing. I think that's the key, otherwise the salsa was lacking herbs, onions, and salt.   The cheese enchilada was amazing--the red sauce being the best I've had to date. I was quite blown away by it. I got the combo with the fried beef tacos. Will skip the fried tacos next time as the beef was a bit tough.   The grilled chicken plate was quite good...ours was slightly overcooked, but the flavors were there. Overall, I felt this place is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Vegas. I shall go back and try more, as well as try see if they are consistent with the food. It will definitely hit the spot if you're craving for some good Mexican food. Try the cheese enchiladas!!!!! quite impressive sauce!

Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champoton- rib eye steak with shrimp fajita

w_uCs5HGbzF-QvREMGwlsg.text: Nice place. Went for a late lunch and had the empanadas.  Came out quickly and hot. The beans came on a tostada and topped with quotija (sp) cheese nice touch. Clean and comfortable with good service. Ample parking is a plus.

AXGydH_xMKwS5fLSQj4LaQ.text: Decent quality Mexican food, my parents who are Mexican loved it so maybe my taste is off. Maybe just my burrito wasn't that good I guess, I felt it had a lack of spices. But again everyone else enjoyed there food, so try it, it's not bad.

Pc1rNEPVPcMJU9G7JQ4uNQ.text: FORGET ABOUT IT!!! wow this place was so good. I recommend this to anyone that is looking for amazing authentic homemade Mexican food. I'm pretty sure the majority of Las Vegas already knows this because the place was packed full of people in Business attire. The service was amazing, the restaurant was clean, the waitress was knowledgeable about the ingredients in the food and understood what I was looking for in my meal. I came with a couple of friends of mine on a lunch date. We were on a limited amount of time, but didn't even have to worry about it. Our food came out super fast super hot and the people are super friendly. I will come back here any chance I get. I can't wait to try something else on the menu!!!!

0nxyZWGdoao_zjRXEuGwtw.text: Found this place after going to Juan's Flaming Fajitas had a 45+ min waiting. What an awesome place!! So much better and quieter. In a shopping center with many competing eateries, this a double five star for the food.   The salsa was complex and had a good zing. Ask fir the green habernero to kick it up. Hubby had best enchilada chicken suizas ever! The sauce was tasty and flavorful. I had pork carnitas that must have been marinating for days. Succulent and complex flavors.   Good range of Mexican beers. Try their Tequila special - $7 for a shot of Herradura Silver. Put in on the rocks with a squeeze of lime. Big YUM!!  This us our new fav in Vegas for Mexican. Service was good but seemed just a little disorganized. Overall, I would accept with the high quality of food.

-LBM9-7_soWXNhe0R7GcNQ.text: We were traveling through and stopped at this Cocina. The service was excellent!  The environment was authentic.  Everything from the salsa to our dinners and our margaritas were so good.  I would say that each dish had its own unique taste but had that extra touch of flavor. I will definitely be back and I will recommend to my friends.

OX46ECWJhR8us0zTiZAhng.text: Yummy! Lots of hidden gems in the menu. Very authentic Mexican. They don't use lard to cook, but canola, which I find to be wonderful and refreshing. Speaking from experience as a native Mexican, I give this place two thumbs-up.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oxafoONjlH8dnKi7OZZcDg.text: The best Mexican food in Las Vegas... my family and I have been eating at Frank and Fina's since 1994 , when they were still west Charleston .

zgLhCRGWStVELfwZHWylSg.text: I've tried many restaurants in Vegas, and a couple months ago I stated that Casa Don Juan was my favorite. Frank & Fina's now takes that thrown. Their carne asada burrito was one of the best I've had, and their mango margarita (yes i drink those) is the nutter butter!

sptgRjJj4RmqhDBCxkciaQ.text: We love Frank and Fina's!  We went again last night, a regular stop when we have friends visiting from CA. .  Very comfortable home type atmosphere, not to loud to catch up with friends!  The food is always fast and delicious. The service is wonderful. We love the homemade Salsa, the Carnitas and the Quesadillas. We will be back.

TGvjojL8l3O2WlF4Rj1FWA.text: The food was literally out 90 seconds after we ordered. $7.50 chicken burritos.  So fresh and so good!  Not greasy at all.  Perfect!  The waitress was on her game and my cup was always full.  I am upgrading this place to 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frank and Fina&#39;s - Front

2CIpvZCbd_ZQ0Eb0o-VhZQ.text: Exceptional. The food was astounding, the service is excellent, and the prices were very reasonable. They have a large section of vegetarian options, tried a few of them and was blown away at the taste! I didn't miss the meat at all! This restaurant is a gem! Not to be missed!!  Note, for those wary of the "Sweet Potato Enchiladas" the filling is chunks of potatos not a sweet potato mash, and they are excellent.

FndLv88n8JHk8cdi4_5vKQ.text: Had dinner with friends who like it here because of the vegetarian menu options. My personal diet is very low carb at the moment, so I had resigned myself to a salad. I ended up having cochinita pibil, achiote marinated pork baked in a banana leaf and subbed a side salad for rice and beans. It was delicious, savory and a touch spicy, not at all too salty which can be a downfall of Mexican pork dishes... The staff was friendly and attentive, my water glass never sat empty, and it was quiet & mellow inside despite having a good evening crowd. I'll definitely visit again.

E32xm7RgDR0Wn7ZkXQe2yQ.text: I love this place ... Too bad is far from where I live but if am around the area that would be the place I will eat .. Love the albondiga soup and the carne asada tacos with corn tortillas!!

UQ5lpjaSQ24YOvO0JI7NRg.text: The service is great, polite and quick. The shrimp fajitas are very good and my bf likes the sweet potato enchiladas. Very unique. they could improve on their salsa...otherwise this is a top Mexican choice

Si8ZV0IwW6ejxN3BRHvALQ.text: Loved the pork (al pastor) with pineapple dish! And the chips and salsa was also very good! My hubby also enjoyed his meal.. Love the server!! He was very sweet and the service was very good as well!! Will be back!

8xMYU4MV4b6sKgn_h7SBew.text: Thank you Yelp. Not for introducing me to another good restaurant, but for introducing me to new friends who introduced me to a good restaurant. I tend to not be the most available individual, but Robyn and Kevin L. have been very patient with me. After a few failed get together attempts, we finally met at Frank and Fina's for dinner.   I have had this on my bookmarks for a few months and was happy to try something new. Of course I fell victim to the infamous Sweet Potato Enchiladas ($10.25) and a Margarita on the rocks with salt ($5.75). Two nice size tortilla rolls filled with mashed sweet potatoes caught me off guard with the natural candy like flavor. After a few more bites, I adjusted, and they were delicious. I was also able to taste Robyn's Guacamole and Kevin's Queso Fundido. Both were good. The first might be bland for some, but I could eat a whole guacamole with nothing else, so that did not bother me. The cheese dip was fantastic. Served with soft flour tortillas, you will need more to get all of the melty goodness. It would be a sin to waste any,  If a good meal is not enough, bring some friends along because it is a chill atmosphere. Throughout dinner, we were checked upon, but it did not interfere with conversation. The quiet setting is perfect for dates or catching up.

nqkjaGhfBMa9UTK4ArAhjA.text: In a city with so many food choices it's nice to know the good ones.  It's a mom and pop type of place with quality food and service.  I've been there many times and the food is always fresh and the service is prompt.  The menu has a wide selection of dishes that range from classic Mexican items to house specialties.  It's defiantly more of a locals place as it off the strip, but if you're in the area check it out.  The fried ice cream is pretty good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BwS3AgdnKpu7UbtOCrowkw.text: We have been in the hunt for a good Mexican restaurant on the south end of the valley and we have finally found it.  The food and service are fantastic!  Every time we visit It's as though they were waiting for us to arrive.

EFjxov2zGz7gX3UIZKraRA.text: Food was amazing. I like Lindo Michoacan (across the street).  I appreciated Frank & Fina's more because it delivered a quieter, more upscale atmosphere. Also, the food was just a bit more refined.  I ate the chicken mole enchiladas, which were amazing and carried a very rich flavor.  Also, we had the cheese dip. It was delicious but seemed to be primarily mozzarella and butter... hardly something that will extend my life.  Five stars because I think Lindo is 5 stars, and I think this might be better.  I will definitely go back.

YVbi391ZVKfh5U6gsfMT8A.text: Really good food, Nice place. The owner comes out and take your order, Wife is in the back helping with the cooking.

rNOnw6c65EzN4NpXLsVCkw.text: Everything I have ever ordered from here is delicious.  The atmosphere is gorgeous, prices are reasonable and the portions are just right.  Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is exemplary.  I have had small children with me on numerous occasions, and they have been running around and making a mess, and the waiters are kind, understanding, and friendly.  One of them even carried my runaway toddler back to the table after she had escaped from me for the fifth time.  When I mentioned to my friend that I was concerned about how I was going to carry my leftovers back to the car (they were in Styrofoam boxes), someone who overheard me from the other side of the wall came and brought me a plastic bag.  I really love going here, and I would especially recommend anyone with kids to visit.

0TO2FMSGDP5OZKA9oZlhSA.text: I've been going to frank n Fina's for a long time, food is always great and so is service. The servers always remember us and make us feel welcomed

xTmhYNG2g1y08MfN0kSR5g.text: My favorite salsa!!!  We absolutely love this place and recommend it to all of our friends.  We have been going here since it was just a tiny little house on West Sahara and it has been great to see them move and expand.  The food and service is always amazing.  My wife likes the chimichanga and I usually get one of the combo platters.    I have actually ordered the salsa to go for parties and such at the house.  The atmosphere is great and inviting and the place is easy to get to right off of the 215.  By far our favorite mexican restaurant.

ZpZHFkkLd8FcJYSWcYoGkw.text: Recently went to Frank and Fina's and the food was not as good as it has been in the past. The fajitas were burned and there was a wait for almost an hour for the food. The enchiladas were average. However we have been there in the past and it has been a lot better...not sure if their food is worse now or if they were just busy.

lAqwt1LWM6Vf0iH8m826Ig.text: Hands down the BEST mexican food in Vegas! Been here at least 100 times & never let down. Great service with a very knowledgeble and team oriented staff. Basically everyone there helps you even the owner Frank who still takes tables. Daily specials from various regions of Mexico & reasonable prices. Try the fajitas or chile colorado.

JgofXreN_yceB7h27GtnrA.text: Those of you that know me, know I am always on the hunt for the best nachos in the world. I have to give Frank & Fina's an honorable "Damn these are good Nachos!" so why not 5 stars you ask? Well I will tell you.. price and portions. For the price of the nachos with grilled chicken I would expect a bigger portion size and more chicken.. a lot more chicken. So here is my recommendation to you the reader, order the grilled chicken nachos and ask them to make them enchilada style (I prefer the red sauce / you might like the green) they make a great appetizer among friends, if I am your friend then get your own damn nachos cuz this plate is mine!

NzY8URb8RFZqGdNC2OV83Q.text: Came in today in the morning around lunch time with a couple of friends it was our first time here we had read the reviews and decided to give it a try. The service was good and the food was alright however half way through our meal we spotted a cockroach behind where we were sitting. Naturally we were grossed out and informed our waiter. The host then came to us and told us she had taking off the drinks we had and apologized to us for the mishap. Im sorry but to think that the kitchen where our meals have been prepare might of came in contact with roaches is the reason it will be the last time we will be coming here.  Their A from the health department should be reconsidered!

WQMtM1__mh6v37seE_ysSw.text: Pretty good and super sweet older man as our server. He really went out of his way to check with the kitchen to accommodate me in my requests in changing some things on a dish that I ordered. We loved the sopapillas for dessert too ;) the only thing weird I noticed was the radio was breaking up and going fuzzy which was semi annoying.

sl8mZHP4BSJ4YsPeACWCYg.text: Food is delicious. Service is terrible.   I have eaten here many times and liked it all of the times. Recently I went back and loved the food!  The salsa is fantastic. The steak fajitas are great! Their enchiladas are good too. The service is horrible!   After asking for a refill of our drinks it took over 7 minutes for them to come back to refill our drinks. After asking for our check it took another 10 minutes to see it!!  I love the food but the service is frustrating!

8vaG2d0IbDkE46TE3to7Lg.text: Authentic Mexican cuisine. The wait staff has always been really nice. I love to get the tostada. I was really happy with the wait staff when I ordered vegetarian and he let me know all the other options other vegetarians order and was very willing to custom build my order to fit my needs. Way to go above and beyond! I have eaten here many times and will continue!

i4D8x8_6-WpRKHo6Fg8LRA.text: Frank & Fina's is a quaint family restaurant serving some really good Mexican cuisine.  I've dined here many times there is never a lack of consistent fresh ingredient flavor.    Daily specials are good, but are always eerily similar to other dishes on the menu.  Service is good and friendly.  Definitely recommend a visit

Fu8X7TYse0JUFlBKL_EV1Q.text: We had the opportunity to try Frank & Fina's today! Delish!  We went there around 1pm on a Saturday, no wait. There were other patrons there but it wasn't overly crowded. As soon as we were seated chips and salsa were placed on the table.  We ordered: -Riesling -Empenadas -#4 combination (1 crispy beef taco, 1 enchilada, rice & beans) -Chicken mole enchiladas  It tasted very authentic and the pricing was moderate for standard fare Mexican food. The beef in the crispy taco, while flavorful, was slightly dry.  Service was very good, multiple waiters helped us and everyone was friendly.  I will definitely be back when a Mexican food craving hits.

odaGdcuOQaSaMU18D_psow.text: I fell in love with the Frank & Fina's on Charleston and Decatur and would go frequently then all of a sudden the building was gone!!  I was so excited to stumble upon this location!!  Well I wasn't so pleased but the food was ok..  The salsa pretty average!  I know to many better places to return here.

Un511SL9K2KriACGAYLGIA.text: This place is WONDERFUL.   I sometimes hate how gaudy Mexican restaurants can be in Vegas. When you walk into F&F's, you know you're in a Mexican restaurant, but it's cute and classy and definitely not over the top. The lighting is dim and it does not feel like every other Mexican restaurant in town. It's really cute inside! I love the vibe and the way the restaurant is set up.    The menu is laid out in a very "American-friendly" way in that the dishes are explained well for those of us who may not know what things are or what the Spanish words for certain dishes mean. That is a huge plus for me!   Within two minutes of being seated, chips and salsa were brought to our table. That is an immediate star. I didn't even have to ask. Also, our drinks were never empty and they came within 30 seconds of ordering. We also ordered bean dip and it was delivered within a few minutes. It was as good as any other bean dip I've had at any other Mexican restaurant, but it came with pico de gallo on top, which was also a plus.   I was flustered and couldn't decide what to order (this happens to me constantly) so I just ordered two tacos - one crispy chicken and one pork adobada with rice and beans. My gf ordered the fajitas. Our food came out within 15 minutes, or at least that's what it seemed like. My gf and I are "talkers" so time almost always goes by quickly when we are dining.   Now, this review may be a bit biased because it was about 8pm and it was the first meal we had eaten all day. We partied pretty hard on Saturday and basically slept all day on Sunday... so we were starving. BUT, my tacos were DELICIOUS. The crispy chicken was juicy and the pork adobada sauce was tasty and not overpowering. There wasn't too much sauce, which I love. Now, these were not as great as the tacos at Tacos Al Gordo, but they was close enough for me! I definitely recommend trying the crispy chicken tacos - YUM.   My gf seemed to really enjoy  her fajitas too! And the prices were extremely reasonable and actually cheaper than most upscale Mexican restaurants I have been to.    As far as food goes, I think this place deserves about 4 stars. However, because the service was so wonderful (we must have had about 3 different people taking care of us) and the ambiance was perfect, I have to give 5 stars.   This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! CHECK IT OUT.  Next time, I'm trying the sweet potato enchiladas! :)

7jXHAWYrc8UaI8ATbVDUmw.text: My dad and I stopped in here one night after taking a cooking class nearby.  It looked interesting and had a good menu.  Besides, we are always up for Mexican food.  Having never heard of Frank and Fina's previously I had no expectations going in.  I leave feeling full but not fully satisfied.  To start, the chips and salsa were alright.  Crisp chips and generic salsa that tastes more of tomato than anything else.  Sure, I ate it by the bowl full but that does not mean it was an outstanding example of what can be a magical accomaniment to a chip.  For dinner I ordered a classic two item combo with a taco and tamale and the obligitory rice and beans.  The rice was good and the beans were refried.  I much prefer black beans to refried pintos but that is just me.  The taco I had was ipressive loaded with flavorful and tender meat.  It dripped half way down my arm towards my elbow.  That is the measure of a good taco.  As for the tamale, the flavor was alright and the ratio of meat to maza was fine.  it was the texture that threw me.  The maza was too smooth and seemed over processed.  I am used to a grittier form of maza.  I guess this isn't my favorite place to get Mexican food.

j8PP8kJUpm18an-YhgzCFw.text: Service is always friendly and food has never disappointed. Great selection of Mexican dishes... Margaritas and sangria were yummy!!

hCEl96GzJ8G5tAdZGvnU0A.text: Frank still takes orders and serves meals at 65+ and it shows in his recipes. This is a must stop for anyone that appreciates good Mexican food and a kind face. Ask him about his multiple black belts.

DOICZo29832n5NHRt6X5qA.text: Went with the traditional steak fajitas. Very good thick peices seasoned well and ask for there hot sauce. Excellent!

P564jIHkWJYFhvTnUwJiKA.text: The food was great. The service was great and the price was great. We went here for lunch and was very thankful that we made the right decision. The mexican food is very traditional and served in very large portions. The free chips and salsa tasted fresh. All I can say is the next time I stay in Vegas, I'm coming here again.

OvA9xqUwcN86_c2S_qnjWg.text: Delicious food and great service! Cute intimate setting good for a date or girls night.

KuKCHFj8rXYF6efU_tUF5A.text: This is a great atmosphere with some great food. the ingredients are fresh and smarty pared. Get the Habanero hot sauce, very good!

g7w2_8T5xwwnPeA1R4qUkQ.text: Well went out with my wife to try some new Mexican restaurant and this was a bad choice.  We walked in and expected something nicer from the outside.  We sat there about ten minutes with no contact from anyone until the busser brought us a bowl of chips and salsa.  Can I just say that the salsa did not taste fresh nor unique.  Well had to wait another ten minutes while we watched the busser clean two table before even asking us for a drink order.  Now we wait for at least 15 more minutes, to the point we almost got up and left but we were hungry.  The older gentleman, that was our waiter, sneaked up and just asked "what can i get you"?  Didn't even introduce him self nor recommended anything.  The food was well BLAH.  My taco was soggy on the bottom and all the filling fell out.  The enchilada was hard to eat due to the over cooked shredded beef.  Well here is where they really messed up.  We sat there with our napkins on our plates for at least 15 min before being presented with the check, from the hostess.  Now we got up to go pay for the meal and the waiter had the audacity to stop my wife and ask her if he can help her with anything insinuating that we were trying to walk out on the bill.  Dude I had the check in my hand.  Even worse he began talking Spanish to the hostess saying "I thought they were trying to leave", once again Dude I speak fluent Spanish.  I can defiantly say we will never be back to this run down, want-to-be Mexican restaurant.  Lo siento pero nunca voy a regresar.

sNtxJWtYs75UWj3QjU4i2A.text: My husband and I, along with our closest friends, are addicted to Mexican food so I got excited when I found this place on Yelp with great reviews. We live close by but always assumed it was an Italian restaurant from the name. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype of the Yelp reviews.  Pros: the salsa, bean dip, and margaritas were good. Also, one of my friends enjoyed his meal, but I don't remember what he got, most likely carnitas. Cons:  1) the queso fundido had NO TASTE, we spent a little more to have chorizo added and there were only two tiny dollops, absolutely not worth the upgrade money spent and the cheese had ZERO flavor.  2) my beef enchilada had a weird taste to it and I wound up only having like three bites because I did not enjoy it at all. My chicken taco was just okay, nothing special, but not bad at all. 3) the rest of the group ordered a quesadilla, taquitos, and a charbroiled chicken dish. All of those were just okay.  Basically we spent a fair amount of time vocally wishing we had gone to Juan's Flaming Fajitas, which is our favorite place. FYI, the queso fundido with chorizo at Juan's is phenomenal. I was hoping Frank & Fina's would become one of our regular spots, but we will probably never go here again since 4 out of 5 of us didn't enjoy it.

4-a3hSnaQscEZnrs0e8Mww.text: Great service and AMAZING food!! The portions are big enough to share with someone but the menu says they charge a $2 fee for sharing.. Chips and salsa are amazing too!! This is what I call authentic Mexican food!! Yummmmmmmyyyy!!

c7p16UgNQmLi70iF1BMfKg.text: Good effort. But not Mexican cuisine by much of a stretch if you know what that is.

TwIBNNKcdQ3V1K7ZxwU1vw.text: This is the best Mexican food in town if you ask me! The salsa is great. All the food tastes homemade. The margaritas are all organic. Lots of vegetarian options, and even some vegan ones. And the service is always fast and friendly.

QgwFBF1AG06Psh2ZVozH8A.text: We ate here last night for the first time.  We have been trying to find a good Mexican restaurant since moving here a year ago.  This is finally it!!  The chips and salsa were very yummy, so right off the get go we had high hopes.  They had a pretty extensive vegetarian menu which made me happy.  I had a crunchy taco and a relleno, and my husband had a carne asada burrito.  All delicious!  Ended with a fried ice cream to split.  It was very good.  We will definitely be back. =)

hJ8e6T3xx-umK-GgE8JFBQ.text: I'm giving it 4 stars because of slower service and my receipt wasn't itemized, just total cost.  Service could have been a little better. They were really nice, but speed wise on the slower end. We were left hanging quite a few times. It was hard to get a server's attention.  HOWEVER, the food was so good I'll still be back. I'm pretty patient with people and will just bite my tongue the next time we go in. We had 2 different margaritas, taquitos, enchiladas, and fajitas. Not to mention the chips and salsa were perfect!

2zXtLXrfUbqucXNAgKezag.text: I am so far overdue on this review. I have been coming to Frank & Fina's Cocina for over six years and it is my favorite place to come to for great authentic Mexican food. I cannot say enough. I have ordered probably 20 different items and have never been disappointed. The service is always 5-stars. The food is delicious and that is because it is made fresh. It comes out so fast that I have waited longer for a mediocre fast food burger than I have for excellent quality Mexican food. Sometimes, I wish the food did not come out so fast, because the salsa and guacamole are as good as it gets for me and my friends and family!   Priscilla and Adrian are tremendous, they are not only great people, but they work hard and their parents (Frank and Fina) should be tremendously proud of the work they put in to make their cocina my favorite Mexican cocina. It is worth the trip from any place in the valley. It will beat almost any place on the Strip and is way more affordable.

x_tuU-QW-IChydX4Fv93JQ.text: This place is awesome! Came here with a girlfriend late afternoon for some margs and Mexican food!   I've always seen this place since I'm always at the Target right by there, and had no idea it was a Mexican restaurant. The interior is incredible and rustic.  I ordered a chicken tamale and chicken enchilada. They were cooked to perfection and the portion size was unbelievable. I had to take half of it to go since I was so full. Even with the free chips and salsa appetizer, I had no more room. My skinny margaritas were perfect. On the rocks and with a salted rim. It was to die for and priced perfectly.  When the bill came, I was shocked how inexpensive it was! Two margs and a two combo plate for less than 30$. Our service was incredible, and so was the food. Thanks guys for keeping my wallet happy and my stomach full!

Kddm5j-vTE81X_nwP1Q-nA.text: Check this out. My wife and I stopped in to enjoy a couple of margaritas after a long day and we were told that they couldn't seat us unless we ordered food. We had not interest in eating, we just wanted a couple of drinks.   I find this very odd. Who does this? I have lived in this town for over 37 years and have never been to a place where we couldn't go and have a drink. This is Vegas for pete sake.   They said if we were seated and ordered drinks we would have to pay for the chips and salsa. We didn't want to eat anything. We would probably have spent more money on drinks than food. Oh well.   Thanks for Lindo Michochan down the street.

4GebUPJUynjBWEEve-H47Q.text: Wanted to pop off the new year right with some delish lookin food. I came to the right place. What I like most about Frank and Fina's is their unique style of Mexican and Central America food. Not authentic, but tasty indeed. I had the chicken enchiladas,Suizas. And my hubby had an al pastor burrito. The al pastor was too sweet unfortunately , almost  like BBQ flavor. Not quite what he was expecting. But I loved my enchiladas made with mozzarella cheese, a little far from traditional style but still good. The sauce, rice and beans were decent as well. I tried their organic lime margarita on the rocks( of course)and it wasn't bad. I would have preferred that they didn't use a pre-made mix but oh well   The service was a little slow at the end of our meal, but the waiter was nice and we got our meals 8-minuets after ordering so that was a plus. Not a very intimate setting, but overall ok. I definitely want to try this place again and try something else :)

QU_LYI-XdYHWdByQPpkhSg.text: This place is hard to beat. The food is great so is the menu. Plenty to choose from. Service is great.

I5bVNm8HSILL1JoTo7JeMQ.text: Used to be our favorite place.  They've  changed their menu offering new selections.  That's great!  We order the same things and have loved them for years. BUT, now that same order was considerable more expensive and a smaller portion.  Realize food costs are going up but a 30% increase and smaller portions? No way, Jose.  The staff is always welcoming and attentive which is a big plus.

cV8srZpA8WTQgnA9anrP_w.text: I don't usually eat at Mexican restaurants, but I was staying at a nearby hotel and it was conveniently located. I also checked it out based on the good reviews. I'm always down to try something new or different.  *Shrimp Tacos* The two tacos were good sized tacos and they were generous with the shrimp. You have your choice of corn of flour tortilla. It came with some lime, refried beans, and rice. Good stuff!  We got good service even though we came in for a late lunch. The place was practically empty by the time we were finished with our meal. Based on this visit, I would definitely give this place another visit in the future. There were other menu items that I would like to try.

zTOi4Y5s-Fl7RFWV8NWXoQ.text: This has been my go to spot for Mexican food for about two years. I was initially brought to Frank and Fina's by a guy I was seeing and although the relationship didn't work out, I always felt that I gained something since I FINALLY found authentic Mexican food in Las Vegas. As a LV transplant from Southern California, I definitely am used to some of the best Mexican food outside of, well, Mexico.  The best part about this lovely spot is that it's family owned and they are always very warm and welcoming. Each and every time I return I feel as though they're genuinely happy to see me come back. In addition, the restaurant is familiar with cooking for vegetarian/vegan guests and has a whole section of meat-free offerings. My personal favorite are the sweet potato and soyrizo tacos. They're incredibly good (especially with the homemade tomatillo salsa).   Unfortunately, I will say that the food is rather inconsistent. On several occasions I have had to send my food back to be remade because it was extremely over cooked/burned and when I have ordered other dishes, I have found them to be VERY bland/under-seasoned. My mom has also had the vegetarian special a few times and has been quite underwhelmed.  Because my overall experience at Frank and Fina's has generally been quite positive, I feel that four stars is pretty on point. Unfortunately, when my food has been bland or significantly over cooked, I would say a lower rating would be more accurate. Give this lovely place a try, I would just suggest sticking with a personal favorite versus a daily special (since they're very, very bland).

qmb3VbcSfJoMmKRx7x6sNw.text: Had a GNO with my gals last week Saturday. The atmosphere was nice! The hostess was welcoming. Our server was really nice and knowledgeable. I ordered the taco salad. It was okay, it just had way to much beans. I did try my friends mole enchiladas and it was soo good! I'll definitely order that next time! Overall, I'd come back!

lXkP50EGDoFsH41riEihRg.text: Frank & Finas is the best Mexican restaurant in town. From the authentic Southwest ambience which is warm and comfortable to the last drop of delicious food cleared off your plate, every moment will be savored. I wish they bottled their sauces, the salsa alone is incredible. Tonight I had the burrito served enchilada style with wonderful flavored red sauce. Both the seasoned beef and the sauce were homemade deliciousness. The dishes served are family recipes brought from the Yucatan to Las Vegas by the owners. This puts each meal a grade above your typical Mexican restaurant. So good. All meals are superb and we have dined here for many years, craving to go back every time. The staff are friendly and treat you like royalty with exceptional service.

78hsL8z-mXrCVlxOhq4rjQ.text: This place is amazing and I'm absolutely addicted! My husband and I have gone here twice in the last two weeks. I usually get the chicken enchiladas but everything we have tried on the menu is great. So far, great service, amazing food, fun atmosphere. I recommend this place to all of my friends and family members.

B8ezQB4OTcvLULRKCR_Eiw.text: I have always had great food and great service from Frank & Fina's! Their menu offers many vegetarian options. I highly recommend!

2NGqo3VgWn6G-Wut9oVzyg.text: Absolutely the freshest !!! We really enjoyed all of our dinners and the service was outstanding!!! Every meal that come was very fresh and hot. Every one went out their way to provide great service and great dinner !!! We definitely will return! Thank you

uzpPXhSGTDXAEZusxb1b0w.text: Items Selected: Chips and Salsa Queso Fundido - Three Cheese Blend, Green Chiles, Pico de Gallo, Chorizo with Flour Tortillas House Tamales - Chile Colorado Beef, Chicken Mole, Melted Cheese, Beans, Rice Churros - Caramel, Vanilla Ice Cream Tres Leches Cheesecake - Whipped Cream, Chocolate  Tucked away in the Grand Canyon Parkway Shopping Center, recent openings such as Cinnaholic and another Rollin' Smoke location joining old favorites like Mad Hatter Cupcakes, it was for lunch on Mexican Independence Day that a seat was taken at Frank & Fina's Cocina, the setting intended to resemble a little piece of Mexico and its employees both pleasant but the food routinely average despite a fairly high price point.  Located at the same spot since 2008, a fairly remarkable accomplishment in a city where the dining landscape sees openings and closings almost daily both on-Strip and off, Frank & Fina's is one of those rare places in Las Vegas that has sustained the test of time despite minimal advertising and little media mention, the patrons on this particularly afternoon almost universally Caucasian and obviously regulars with an average age North of fifty despite two well-behaved children dragging that number down.  In some ways a 'theme' restaurant, the decor intentionally transportive with overhead music ethnically appropriate and items such as a Tequila Bottle shaped pinata hanging not far from a painting of Frida Kahlo, diners at Frank & Fina's Cocina are greeted from a small hostess stand labeled "Que Pasa?" on entry, the tables filling two rooms and the Menu totaling five pages plus a handful of daily specials.  Named after its ownership and offering a typical American-Mexican menu, the obligatory basket of Chips and mild Tomato Salsa fairly forgettable though the Tortillas are served warm, it was after perusing a predictable list of Enchiladas, Tacos and Fajitas that eyes landed on some items that stood out as somewhat unique, the Appetizer quickly up-sold by a pleasant young Mexican waiter who did a great job covering a lot of real estate as he appeared to be the only employee working the room.  Fairly quick in terms of service, an okay to serve both Appetizer and Entree at the same time seeing merely ten minutes between placing an order and receiving Food, it was after briefly surveying the landscape that a Chip was used to scoop up some of the Queso Fundido that had already started to turn somewhat rubbery, the $2 addition of "Chorizo" no more than a tablespoon and certainly not spicy with a taste and texture not unlike ground Beef.  Off to a fairly inauspicious start, the $9 plate similar to what one might pay in a Casino for something better, it was onto warm Flour Tortillas that additional Cheese was scooped along with flaccid Peppers before moving on to a combination plate of standard-issue Beans and Rice plus two Tamales, the Chile Colorado Beef featuring shredded Meat actually quite good while the "Chicken Mole" ordered was inexplicably covered with a sour green Salsa that made one wonder whether the server instead wrote down "Chile Verde Pork" or if the kitchen accidentally added the wrong Sauce to the flavorless cubes of Meat inside a steamy roll of Corn.  Holding out hope for Dessert, $4.95 for one room-temperature Churro broken in half and piped with Caramel both ridiculously priced and fairly underwhelming next to store-bought Vanilla Ice Cream, it was at an even more eyebrow raising $6.95 that a thin wedge of "Tres Leches Cheesecake" from the Specials board was offered, the sponge moist but not 'wet' while the center was more firm than creamy, as though it was nothing more than Cream Cheese with a little bit of Sugar mixed in.  **Offering pleasant service and a comfortable setting, the ownership and staff both doing their best to create a family-friendly environment harkening something one might find The Mission or in a small Mexican community in Phoenix, Frank & Fina's unfortunately lacks in terms of quality and execution with dishes that do not fit the price point.

2cLxB_GCAZmvVGGoF0916w.text: I would return here exclusively to just have the empanadas again! These were outstanding. Perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They came with a delicious house made dipping sauce. I tried the mango margarita. It came frozen and it had a very nice, fresh flavor. I do think that they went a little light on the tequila. The fresh made chips and salsa was also delicious. But definitely try the empanadas!

I8uynkFmCpojAveZQ_8Thw.text: So.....  I had a pretty terrible experience here this past week. I called in an order on Wednesday evening, dinner for that evening and lunch for the following day. I ate my dinner that evening, taco salad and a side of beans, no prob. The next day I was eating the lunch portion - just the beans. I was just finishing the cup and of course took the final bite, when all of a sudden I bit into something solid. I spit it out and was surprised - I was staring at a small metallic ball!!  I scraped around and found a SECOND small metallic ball!!!  I immediately called Frank & Finas and asked for a manager. I was told there wasn't one on site so I explained the situation to the person answering the phone. They put me on hold and then Fina picked up. Her response astounsed me:  "well, you should have kept it..  What do you want me to do?"  I informed her that I DID keep it and would be bringing it to her after work. When I got there the hostess had pulled my receipt from the night before and asked if I wanted a Gift Card or my cash back.... Ummm, I really just want to know what the heck I put in my mouth and how the heck it got there. Ultimately, I settled for my money back with no explanation and not even an apology from the owner.  My suggestion for the owners and management of this establishment is to take a course in customer service. A simple explanation and apology would have went a really long way here!
