N-vTyB3WEf4aQh3STm2Tmg.text: This is my all-time favorite Mexican restaurant!   I really cannot say enough good things about this Gem of a family-owned and operated restaurant!   The very first time I came here and walked through the doors I loved the homey ambiance and the welcoming feel.  The excellent customer service is consistent and caring, everyone here wants to make your meal an exceptional experience every time you walk through the doors!!   The owners and family members are always here to greet you and to make sure everything is top-notch quality and you can tell they take pride in the food that they serve.   The homemade salsa is the best salsa I have ever had in my entire life! On my last visit I bought a big container to take home!   The mole sauce is outstanding & just what you would expect mole to be.  I don't live anywhere close to Frank and Finas, however I am happy to make the drive for what I know is going to be a consistent delicious homemade Mexican meal!!   Thank you Frank and Finas!!!    You guys are THE BEST!!!!!

gcdnr7ShBfDB9K3ey6kn-A.text: First time here.  Every other time there was a long line of customers, so I took that as a good sign.  The food was excellent; I had the Chicken Mole dish and everything was presented beautifully and the tastes were exciting to my taste buds.  The mole was tangy and had a pleasant aftertaste.  The was exceptional--everyone was very kind and attentive.  And, I got to meet Frank and Fina, who were dining here as well.  They both took the time to come to my table, thank me and and my guest and ask us how we enjoyed our dining experience.  !Muy amabile!

we4GHOMC3ZDwCJ2lxQ06zQ.text: I went there a couple of times. Food is good but today when I went there for lunch today with my coworkers. We asked the waitress for separate checks after we were done.  she said with the worst attitude " next time tell me that you want separate checks ". Didn't think that it's that big of deal to separate the checks. Update: went back a couple of times and the servers we had was a lot more friendly.

G5mn9HqqgG73g7bb6rQhtw.text: This restaurant was highly recommended by friends who had frequented it for twenty years! That, in and of itself, is a heckuva endorsement! RR7O7hbO5NOZv_LBirUNEQ.text: Absolutely wonderful food, service and ambience.  We hadn't been in awhile and I had forgotten what a lovely place this is.  We'll be back more often.

v_wPhxxoKtvYMtcYsyboUA.text: I've loved this place for many years, since they had the original downtown location on Charleston. Great, dependable food. Comfortable, neighborhood atmosphere with a relaxed, unhurried pace. My favorites are the carnitas which are fantastic on their own or in other dishes, the taco salads and the tamarind margaritas. Most of the staff have been there for a long time which is a testament to the ownership and means they know what they're doing. It's definitely family friendly and it's easy to find simple dishes but there are also plenty of authentic things to try and new specials frequently. Like I said I've been going often for a long time and never been disappointed.

OEP5gCCtIFOsbcEqri_MOQ.text: THIS PLACE!!! Great food...wish i knew about this place sooner! Cute, quaint establishment, and the service is fantastic!

eNjvN-gHfPA1gD_szGt4qA.text: Best Cochinita Pibil in town! Food well cooked and season perfectly!  We enjoyed the Queso Fundido w/chorizo.  Excelent service from Rafael

lWFOy3WWmCOFVNikDorBfQ.text: I was excited when I walked in- the atmosphere was great and I liked the decor. The chips were crisp and the salsa mild. The staff were very accommodating. I ordered the chicken taco salad. It was VERY bland and watery. The "homemade" guacamole was also very bland. My 7 yr old had the chicken which was pretty dry. Sorry- El Pollo Loco has tastier food. Will not be back.

bkzfZ39L9WmIFR207U_iIg.text: Let me start out by saying this place is awesome! I have been looking for a good Mexican place for awhile and I have to say as a fan of Mexican food that is my new favorite place to go. The Ambience is amazing and makes you feel like you are in a Cantina in Mexico. And you will absolutely love their delicious and exotic Margarita selection. I started out with a blended mango margarita and was eventually steered by our awesome and extremely friendly waiter to walk on the wild side and try their jalapeno margarita which was fabulous. As for their food it was not only delicious and authentic but beautiful in presentation and extremely fresh. I highly recommend their homemade guacamole it was some of the tastiest I have ever had. Our awesome waiter recommended the special a fajita bomba which my wife had and it was amazing topped with guacamole , and sour creme. I had the enchilada suizas   And they were some of the best I ever had. My daughter had the carne asada steak and they marinate it something that makes it taste like heaven. For desert I was recommended to try their homemade orange and cream cheese flan and it was absolute heaven. We found our place and I will be returning next week to bring my mother in law here for her birthday. I highly recommend this place if you are a lover of Mexican food.b

X2EHqMoLsGZQ8Ep8ZIMfjw.text: Excellent authentic Mexican food. I usually order a carne asada burrito chimichanga style. Great margaritas.

OCoGhokEWefEBEW3xyfKOg.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. The food and staff are amazing, and they have some of the best salsa in town!

yc4IVt-K1V-sn8Dw_31iNg.text: We used to go Frank & Fina's when they had a location on Charleston. My wife loved their flan and was having a flan craving the other days, so we decided to venture out to this location.  I had the shrimp fina which was quite delicious. My wife ordered the sweet potato enchiladas. That was also pretty good. I was afraid I wouldn't like it 'cause I don't like sweets. However, it was just a very muted sweet.  To cap off our dinner we shared the coconut flan. It was quite good, and my wife continues to contend that Frank & Fina's Cocina has the best flan out there.

vKPWWOl3MineqfzmZG8F7A.text: Most amazing crab enchiladas and tamarind margaritas. Also every one of the staff is so awesome!

p2YpKBAgepg5q9MlPQKRBA.text: I came here for lunch with some coworkers. The service was good, as my drink was always refilled timely. The chips and salsa likewise. However, the salsa was a bit bland. It lacked flavor and heat. For my meal, I ordered the tamales (one beef and one pork). It came with a side of rice and beans, which is standard for any sit down Mexican restaurant. The tamales were extra cheesy on top. A definite plus in my book. The meats were tender and delicious. The portion size was ample. Overall, a solid restaurant.

gWh0VYZueFxFBUwQxtuSGg.text: Met a colleague here for lunch the other day.  It was my first visit to Frank & Fina's.  I arrived early and was seated promptly by the hostess.  While I was browsing the menu, the owner Frank came out with Chips & Salsa and asked for my drink order suggesting a Margarita or Beer....hmmm, ok!  You don't have to ask me twice in a Mexican Restaurant if I want a Margi or Beer.  I ordered a Pacifico....what the hell, I don't have to go into an office and my afternoon was clear.  While I waited for my friend, I decided I'd order the Nachos.  He arrived a few minutes later saw my Pacifico and ordered one for himself....I love how contagious Beer in a Mexican Restaurant can be!  We ordered our lunch and I like how the waitress asked me if wanted Jalapenos on my Nachos....I asked her if they could cut it fresh and put a lot on top...she said yes.  We had a nice conversation while we waited for our food, which came out a short time after we ordered.  The place was packed for lunch and I expected the service to be much slower, but it wasn't.  The Nachos were very good.  The proportion of Cheese, Guacamole, and Sour Cream were just right.  The proportion of Salsa and Onions were good too, relative to the amount of Chips.  The portion was on the Appetizer menu and it could easily feed two or three.  It's not a huge pile of Nachos like you find in some restaurants. For $5.50, it's not bad.  The flavor of all the ingredients were very good too.  The only complaint I have is that the Chips are too thin....they broke easily with the slightest amount of pressure....which forced me to eat most of the Nachos with a Fork.  That's sacrilegious to some Nachos aficionados...LOL  We had another Pacifico and continued our conversation for a while after lunch.  It was a pleasant experience.  As a bonus, I ran into two friends I haven't seen in 8 yrs who were sitting a the table next to us.  Overall it was a good time.  Will I return?  Of course!

2NlGpW4lboE_MlE84LE57A.text: * Good food * Fast service * Fair prices * The staff was friendly and definitely had some personality... * The only reason I didn't give them a fifth star is because they do not give free chips and salsa! boo

60iJmw1-SLI-0I8yddq89Q.text: We've been dining at Frank and Fina's for many years. Always excellent service! The food is perfect. Staff is always friendly. Great atmosphere. All around great dining experience! Try the grilled chicken dishes. Don't forget to try the flan for dessert!

36ehpRdUWyQDRuWDw_l5eQ.text: We've been to Frank and Fina's a few of times and have not been disappointed yet.  We really like the food and service here - we always get a nice waiter.  The ambience is also not bad either!  Very clean and homey feeling and prices are reasonable in my opinion.  If you're watching what you eat, the roasted chicken with tortillas on the side is a good option (think El Pollo Loco, but better).  I think I got two pieces one time and it was huge.    A favorite of ours is the carne asada torta.  Awesome!  The bread is nicely toasted and the guacamole is abundant.  Their meats are good too.  My kind of torta!  The burrito is also good - be sure to get it enchilada style.  The complimentary fresh chips and salsa is also a nice touch.  This Mexican fare is simple, but delicious.  That coupled with good prices and a nice environment makes this a place we will visit again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torta plate

LKXDMiA0LlWkeBs1gBaoPg.text: Mediocre Mexican. Referred by a friend but was not overly impressed, tried the chicken it was tasty but dry. Service was slow. I thought the restaurant was comparable to the other casual dining Mexican restaurants in the area. Unlikely to return.

HNhs0k2THcFOxoS41oG1gA.text: This place is still open? Wow. I would've thought it should be closed by now. Have been to this place 3 times and every time I have gone not happy with their food and service. 3rd was the charm but to not go back. Never going back to this place even if it's free.

0KNw5FlAScpOMIEQR2vj3A.text: When we visit Las Vegas anymore, we don't bother with The Strip. The first thing we do before even checking into a room is to eat at Frank and Fina's Cocina. I don't know why they bother with menus because everything they serve is golden. Today we got one of the house specialties, chicken mole enchiladas, and a delicious shrimp dish cooked with pineapple.  The staff is always personable and helpful explaining the dishes. It's located in an easy-to-get-to shopping area in Summerlin. Lots of parking, no hassle finding it. So classic Vegas? Been there, done that. Now we relax with this wonderful Yucatan restaurant, another restaurant here in Summerlin (Lola's), and beautiful drives through Red Rock Canyon, also near Summerlin. A trip here should be relaxing, not frenetic. No better way to start that process than at Frank and Fina's. I promise you'll rave about the unbelievably delicious food.

UNQzce0c-N-pb2HojMNS3Q.text: My visit to this restaurant was with the intention to find the new "go to" Mexican food restaurant. There are so few in Las Vegas that I feel are high quality that I was hoping to find one and Frank & Fina's.   We arrived on a Sunday around 430PM and there was 1 other table, so there was not a lot of customers but there were several staff. The staff were very attentive and kept the drinks filled. The restaurant and restrooms were clean.  The food was terrible. None of the food had seasoning or flavor and did not meet quality expectations. I personally ordered the Charbroiled Chicken and it tasted chewy and like it had been heated up in the microwave. The carne asada fries had low quality frozen fries and ended up not tasting very good, maybe old meat? My daughter ordered the quesadilla and ate half of it and said it was "ok". None of my family was impressed with the food and we were avid fans of Leticia's before they closed their locations and moved into the SantaFe.  Unfortunately we were surprised by this venue having a solid 4 stars when the food is not even good at best.  Friendly service, but the food falls flat.

YPd6YMFHuxewrEMdS_GA6g.text: My friend asked me wanted I wanted for dinner and I said Mexican. She immediately thought if this place and I'm so glad she brought me here.  The service was great and the food was even better.   I ordered the Carne Asada which came with rice, beans, and flour tortillas. I ate until I was so full that my belly started to hurt but in a good way.  Their flavored margaritas were tasty and we both had two that night.  We were their last customers of the night and they did not rush us out at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita

6tA2J1xCYQeHLzQchp1xHQ.text: This place has definitely improved! The fajitas bomba are still amazing. Chips still awesome! Salsa is a little better, chunky and not too spicy.   We had a larger party this trip, so we had a lot more food! Hubby had steak fajitas- crisp, deliciously sizzling veggies, melt-in-your-mouth steak, huge helping of cheese, sour cream, guacamole too! Chicken - marinated in fruit juices, this chicken is tender, juicy, delicious! Chicken taquitos-these are HUGE! Drenched in guacamole, sour cream & cheese, the appetizer gets you four giant taquitos! Tamales & mole with "the best mole sauce I've had in a while!" Enchiladas, swimming in delicious red sauce, again not too spicy and covered in cheese with sour cream and guacamole. And of course, my favorite- fajitas bomba-chicken, mushrooms, veggies, cheese, covered in sour cream and guacamole and served with rice and beans. Btw-the beans here are the best I've had in Vegas, ever.   Wait staff is still fantastic. Service with smiles and quick! Never asked for a water refill, margaritas were frosty delish!   They do not nickel and dime - generous portions of good tasting, authentic-y food!

1BYrhjQ_2eXHnx3PHpGoBA.text: The good:  Fast service, friendly, well prices for portion control.  The food was very flavorful and was serves hot.   The in between:  They have out grown the space.  Tables pushed into ever possible nook, lots of noise, no privacy. Felt a lot like steerage crammed into a feeding stall.  The bad:  No bar.  They do sell adult beverages, but they insist in you ordering food and will offer up the suggestive selling of:  Buy chips & Salsa & you can hVe. Beer.   No outdoor seating,  and one private bathroom per gender.    I never knew our waiter, as we had 4 separate people serving us, this took away from any type of personalization.   Tip:  So NOT bring small children.  The tables being crammed together leaves for unattended and ill mannered children to stick there fingers in peoples plates, and when they trip and fall they will smack there face into chairs & table corners.

bIAx9FdEMBTLSSzHyRUTLA.text: Really outstanding and authentic! Service was great and food delicious! Nice business, will be back!

Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Azteca

vDkZlJLHe83V6Q-_1Xroww.text: I was so happy the place I wanted to eat was closed! I stumbled out of the hot Vegas sun into a quiet and much appreciated Cocina. The Salsa was on point! Not sure that it was made in house- but I'll do my best next time to get the Guacamole. The desserts also caught my eye. If you've read my other reviews you'd know I consider myself a nacho connoisseur of sorts. Chips were fresh- not stale- which just Ruins a nacho plate. Plate was burning hot so I know it was fresh from the oven. Salsa and guacamole were both good. And the carne Asada was on point-  I'll certainly be back- OH! The host and Wait staff are Superb!! This really makes a good business in my mind - and I saw at least three young families here- so they're good with babies in children seat and cradles!

6zYYotcv6qtA9YPanN31Hg.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vegas! We've been there many times and continue to go quite often because not only is the food good, the service is too! I don't think I've ever ordered anything I didn't like.   They start you off with chips and salsa. The salsa is very tasty and not spicy at all. I always have to stop myself from getting full before my main dish comes out. This last time we went I ordered the green chilaquiles with chicken and added two eggs on top. They were perfectly tangy and rather spicy. My husband ordered the carnitas plate, and that's what I'll be ordering next time we go! I also had a blended house margarita and enjoyed it.   The atmosphere is rather nice at Frank and Fina's. The lights are dim and the music is at a perfect volume. My husband and I will continue to come and enjoy the delicious Mexican food and margaritas!

5pThCqEcUN80SiYV8kbyeg.text: What a great little find. Excellent Mexican food. Nice decor, great friendly service and staff. The food was delicious.  This is definitely a place we will visit again.  Its refreshing to see an owner/ manager as involved in the restaurant as what we watch. From delivering food to rolling silverware

U14cJM395ejOTuQ9e6PEmg.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants in town! Their green enchilada sauce was HEAVENLY! Perfect example of how tamatillo sauce should taste! Right amount of spice and the right amount of lime! It wasn't runny and bland like most places! The rice is clearly someone's grandmother's recipe! It tasted SO authentic! This place is a 10/10! Will definitely be back!

LpMn9SX8HRRl5iB83kXbgg.text: Worked the entire weekend and decided to order some good Mexican food to end the day. The order came with part of the food missing. This is the 2nd time in a row that the order was incomplete and we had to wait almost a full extra hour for the remainder to be delivered. When you're ordering for two people and one persons food does not arrive, No one eats. So now the food that was delivered first sits to become cold and soggy.   Then I bite into my quesadilla and pulled this long 2 1/4" black hair out of my mouth. I do not have black hair, I have bright pink hair and no one else opened my food but me. The only other person in my house has a shaved head.

I had the Chicken Enchilada and a Chicken Tamale combination plate with rice & beans.  It was delicious.  The service here was fantastic, the food was excellent, the house wine was tasty.  I will definitely be back.

9SKJDzYNfl1jtnf1l3N3IA.text: I've been coming to this restaurant for 15 years it is amazing, I have never had a bad meal anytime I've ever come here. The food is always delicious, the  service terrific. it's all you can ask from  a great Mexican restaurant!  thank you Frank and Finas!!

HiVapiWE_tJgMmNLajnEbQ.text: My son and I came here while in town for a swim meet. The food was very good and the prices were reasonable. Everything seemed to be made fresh. We enjoyed the chips and salsa. My son had the tamales...the pork was his favorite. He also loves the rice and beans that came with his meal. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely come back.

zHqPwJ2VeD8yrXNarozb8Q.text: This place was cool. I had a little time to wait while handling other business in the area. The staff was gracious and very friendly. The food was good and the portion sizes were just right. This place offers a good deal for the price that you pay for your food.

qayNQAzJhKRbjjOXHX-Ksw.text: Rafael offered us some pleasant service. We had an incredible dinner with the family. The fajitas were amazing. The only friendly tip would be to add more light. It's a bit too dim in the restaurant. I could barely read the menu. Other than that, the La Prensa Merlot was perfect. The lady however was rude and unprofessional.

sb7pUmFPa_nH-FjC7JeYXA.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant.   The El Pastor is fantastic,  everything here has been great.  The service is on point, always ready to offer food, drinks, and continued checking on you.  We been here a few times before I rated it.  Big plus is we never had to wait, for anything.

zzy-HNvmEcjFnsnq0XP4ig.text: A little gem! Definitely doesn't look super appealing from the outside but it was great!  Interior was inviting, & The service was amazing. Food was delicious too... love supporting smaller local businesses... we will keep coming back. Thanks Frank and Fina's!

uFGyxMPQbzx11j47xGKrqg.text: My family has been coming here for near 10 years and it is a sentimental tradition. Food is always consistently good not great. Service is always nice and pleasant.   Their bean dip is super delish to start with. They also have great salsa!  Lunch specials are very nicely priced.  Great chile verde, carnitas, and salmon tacos.  They even have great vegetarian options: sweet potato enchaladas, veggie tamales, etc.  If you're in the neighborhood check it out

htRlIiAhI1wu_vb861798Q.text: So we went here a couple years ago and it was such a bad experience I must of blocked it out of my memory. But I just saw them featured on an episode of Dirty Dining and it all came flooding back.    I'll make this short. They sat us next to a table where someone threw up. All over the floor. They knew there was vomit all over the floor and they still sat us there. Then they proceeded to argue with me about it. Too the point it got really nasty and they were even cursing...at me! Who the f*** wants to sit next to vomit while eating? Why does that question even need to be asked? So they're on the brink of losing their restaurant? Good. The kitchen sounds like a disgusting nightmare.

9SCgTDjCZSSM5Fl9rlq5lA.text: Very friendly staff - we left full - the carne asada burrito was very good.  Nachos also very good. Had sopatillos and churros w/ ice cream for desert - kids and wife ate them all up.

XnMqtmv8BTnNWW4HmZYLQQ.text: Authentic Mexican. Worth the drive from Hendo. I always get Chili Colorado. Very flavorful red chile sauce. Empanadas are a tasty starter.

oc0Prfif74WcCwKACv2tmA.text: My first time eating here & I loved everything!! I can't wait to go again even though I don't live nearby! I loved all the comments & can't wait to try the items you don't find at other Mexican restaurants. I ordered my usual, a chili relleno and a pork/carnitas taco and it was by far the best tasting pork I have had in a long time! My son ordered the steak fajitas & they were amazing too. I tried a piece of the steak that basically melted in my mouth! The flavor & the tenderness was amazing! I am always amused when people complain about the salsa & chips because that is one item that I find to be so different in every Mexican restaurant! I have friends that love the really thick chips and I love the super thin. I don't like a salsa too spicy but then most people like it really hot. I just have never gone to a Mexican restaurant because of it's chips & salsa. It's almost better when I don't like those because I don't fill up on them & become too stuffed when my main entree comes! The service was great too! That can make me not return! Being I was a food & cocktail waitress for many years I expect good service but at the same time I know what they go through so I have extra patience for certain things but friendliness is a must! I will definitely be back!!!

0YW9eZAsRH7-25m3YOK1wg.text: Good, quick classic Mexican food! Nothing fancy, but very tasty.

pujSPjFcI54I33uLIuIYsw.text: Yelp usually never fails me. Tonight it TOTALLY did. This was the 3rd worst Mexican restaurant we have eaten at in our 17 1/2 years of marriage. Service was slow. Salsa was bad. Ordered chicken fajitas for 2 and it wasn't worth one and it was $26!!! The chicken had lots of gristle. 4 x more veggies than chicken. Margarita was SMALL and totally not worth $11. There will not be a 2nd chance.

It5d1wDIOH2S_PcSNsd0nA.text: I live close by and normal go down town for Mexican but came based on the other reviews and was not disappointed. Very good service that was fast. The food had a beautiful presentation and was very tasty. Had the house margarita and it was smooth and filled within alcohol.  Would have given them  5 stars but no hot sauce on the table.

i5zSpi0C2Ln-GeSG3y99KQ.text: First time we have eaten here... We have stopped in for a beverage with friends... So happy we tried their food!  It is very tasty, everyone in our group from Jeff Speakman's 5.9 Kempo loved their meal. The taco salad was a big fav & the meatball soup was getting rave reviews. Carne Asada was delish!!!

oK9NzOsA1HAhkb_znG9j6A.text: I love Frank & Fina's Cocina ! I used to live down the street from them, it's too bad that I live 20 miles away from the restaurant now. I still try to come here whenever I can, I LOVE their Abondigas soup and the Panuchos.

swZPJj_kgVhQWlj3Qhz55Q.text: Love how quickly the food is served here and how fresh all of the ingredients are!  Like the pineapple margarita!!  Yum!!  Dislike nothing!  Favorite dish has got to be the chicken and avocado salad with chipotle dressing!!  Such a great salad which is nice to find at a Mexican restaurant.

X1pFwEausMfZ3DKOH6B5cw.text: Always check the waitstaff when you walk in. You can tell they cater to the Caucasian dollar, don't plan to leave them less than a 25percent tip. They are not your 5.00 tip people. Very over the top almost borders on gourmet food & service. For 2 peeps you will easily spend 60bucks....This is not a cheap date place

RdYOQkIEamD-dXqluBjSoQ.text: This place blows Lindo Michoacan out of the water! Friendly staff, quiet atmosphere, CLEAN restaurant! I drive 40 min just to eat here!

gfLC71OzzFETHRk4aYD6Zg.text: Great food, great staff! This little place is so much better than the big chain Mexican restaurant across the street. Chips and salsa are delicious, and the enchiladas I usually order are fantastic! I do wish their drink prices were a bit cheaper, but that's just a minor issue :)   There are usually families with small children, so be aware of that if you prefer a more adult environment. We usually do, but when we crave Mexican food, it's worth it :)

FNnBRgt1umJtRCi14-HI9Q.text: I am very impressed with Frank & Fina's! I had actually never heard of the place, but I was in the area and am always looking for good Mexican food, so I thought I'd give them a try.  Turns out the food is very good, among the best Mexican I've had in Vegas (and I've been searching for good Mexican restaurants here for nearly 3 years!). I've been several times now, and the service can be spotty, but everyone is always friendly.  I wish they stayed open a bit later, but I suppose the area doesn't support many late night restaurants. :)  Overall, Frank & Fina's has become my "go-to" place for Mexican food. The atmosphere and friendliness are good, and the food has been consistently pretty good. The chips and salsa are great by the way! Price-wise, they are about typical for mid-range Mexican food.  If you haven't tried this place, definitely give it a shot!

aSbMFeLLSUQO52DFGacPKg.text: Been here a few times.  It hasn't been as good as it was, but decent Mexican food and drinks.  It is still a good place to go for lunch, but not in the top 10 Mexican food restaurants in town.

SXpnkYQgljPuQUlg8U7JzA.text: If you don't have good salsa and you're a Mexican restaurant...what's the point?  And if your chips are seriously worse than the store bought, then what?? Not impressed!!  Been here about a dozen times holding out on this.  The rib eye steak was tough and thin!

pPgK2EuyCxlyEQnMcKlGhA.text: My friends mispronounced the name so I thought I was agreeing to an Italian meal, but was pleasantly surprised.  My gf doesn't usually like Mexican food, but both she and I walked out saying we'd surely be back.  The best point here is the service.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good, but the service is terrific.  The hostess and servers are all very personable.  And if it's their table or not, all servers are looking around the entire restaurant to see that everyone is happy.  Can someone teach other restaurants this simple lesson?    Food:  My gf really enjoyed her shrimp, in a very tasty sauce (I don't know which), and a big enough serving to provide leftovers.  I had the Huevos Rancheros, which are among the best I've had in Vegas.  Everywhere I go, I try the Rancheros and am typically disappointed.  It's become a running joke with my friends and me.  So when the waitress recommended it, we laughed, but she persisted.  Thank you!    The waitress also recommended the sweet potato enchilada - delicious!  Not too heavy, and not too cheesy/saucy.  They've nailed this dish perfectly.    My gf loved the flan, but I thought it was a bit too dense.    Summary, this is a solid place to eat, with very reasonable prices.  This goes in our regular rotation.

Iw-vmQK6drx4mYnkzyZEoQ.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas! I always get the chicken enchiladas with sour cream and a mango margarita. Their salsa is THE BEST. Nice place with great prices.

EjsyFq2qRU9VTy1jcSfuDQ.text: This place is amazing! I am visiting Las Vegas and am vegan, and when I said that I was vegan (to Frank, the owner and our server) he knew what I meant and had a suggestion. I went with his suggestion, the homemade vegetable tamales with a red sauce without the dairy, served with rice and beans. SO. GOOD. I also go the guacamole and that was also amazing!  The staff was friendly, the place was comfortable and the food was delicious! Can't wait to come back to Las Vegas now!

1LjhC8U8zccndguMo6YWCQ.text: Awkward uncomfortable seating, bad ambience and lighting, salsa tasted like ketchup. This was not authentic mexican food but watered down american-friendly whitewashed "mexican food." Soup was bland, Mole was not a good flavor. I should've just gone across the street. Wanted to try something new but was disappointed.

z0dxK7Zq9KbMORZcveVDlQ.text: I've heard a lot of people talk about the sweet potato enchiladas at Frank and Fina's. I finally got around to trying them and yeah, they were good. They weren't the transcendent culinary experience I expected, but they were tasty. It's basically just mashed sweet potatoes in a tortilla and topped with red sauce, cheese and sour cream. They weren't too sweet and the sauce added a delicious blend of spices to it. The dish came with rice and black beans. It wasn't a cheap lunch ($11), but it was good.  The service was ridiculously quick. I probably waited around 5 minutes after ordering before the food came out. So, if you're looking for a quick spot for a sit-down lunch head over here.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato enchiladas

4yMRXBvn6kIOC5RPS4yXlQ.text: Chuck at Royal Links GC highly recommended Frank & Fina's when we asked for a good Mexican restaurant.  He was right.  Started with guacamole, chips and salsa.  Chicken enchilada suizas, chile rellenos, Chicken Nolan (a specialty) beans, rice and fried bananas with the Chicken Nolan.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  The service was excellent and Frank is a character and you can see he really enjoys what he does.  Finished with sopaipillas with honey and cinnamon sugar and ice cream on the side.  Yummy.  We are only here a week, but definitely going back.  A must try.

yPTdPUiXCfnckLhUKbaOWA.text: F&F's Cocina is a nice hole in wall Mexican restaurant off the 215 and flamingo.  This restaurant has a nice Cali/Mex decor and super fast service.  Went for lunch and the place was empty.  Compliments on some great fresh salsa that is very comparable to Lindo Much (my personal favorite).  Had a burrito with the sides and enjoyed my meal... Overall the price was right and the place was clean, fast, and flavorful so I give it a thumbs up.

jcwAw7Z2_2maJUmgZxPYNw.text: This is a friendly local restaurant.  The service is quick and the staff friendly.  It's a good place when you want Mexican food but want a step up from fast food or casual quick.  I will say, however, on both of my visits, my meal was good but arrived at my table barely warm.  Would have been better had my meals been served hot.  Dinner for 2 including drinks and tip was just over $40.00.

FMyA717UzIhg8SKijj2eRg.text: My favorite salsa in town. Sometimes I just stop by to buy a big tub of it to go! Can't go wrong with the sweet potato enchiladas or any item with carne asada. Another must: the queso fundido as an appetizer. You'll be fighting over it!

r-yF5NMfDjraIlmwE_W-8g.text: This place has great Mexican food! I come here whenever I am in town and the proportions are great :) The chicken mole is amazing and a family favorite :) The atmosphere is also very quaint and calming! Great place to go :)

YEnbE4I1BRI3zqXrCabdWg.text: I freakin LOVE this place! Its reasonably priced and the food is so tasty! I've gone with the chile verde pork burrito enchilada style everytime! Just cant seem to change it up but I've been told and seen the other plates...tasty!

rj3OiiD6ITZB1E3T_7q8gQ.text: We were huge fans of their old location (Charleston & Jones I think, in an old IHOP building) and followed them to Summerlin when they opened there. They have the best Mexican food in Vegas, hands down. I do miss the charm of the old and rustic building as this new place has been Summerlin'd. If you like the heat, ask them to bring out their Habanero sauce. It's very deceptive and looks like a cream based sauce. I have no idea what manner of witch created this sauce, but it's pretty deadly.

trMNZFJ5ePAzZy7toLDAcA.text: I've dined here a few times, it's the cochinita pibil that keeps me coming back. First tried it in the Yucatan and this is one of the few places where I am able find similar flavors.

q7gHsRjFXJRtt40BUyKfYA.text: I was at frank and finas about a month ago for lunch with my mother in law and two kids. It was completey empty except for one other table. The older gentleman, which I later found out was the owner, was very rude! He sat us at a four top in the very back corner. One side was a bench. My kids, like most little ones, we're fighting over who got to sit by grandma. We asked the owner if we could have the bigger table so that both could sit by grandma. He answered "why? What's wrong with this table?. We need that table for larger parties.". We both looked around and said "oh because you are so busy?!". Needless to say he wouldn't move us and not one other table came in while we were there!!!! REALLY?!!!!!!!! Wow! Lol.  On another note the food was great. I later called to speak to him and once again he was rude and Truely believed he was right. I work in the same industry and understand why larger tables are needed but when the place is completely empty I don't see what the big issue was!  stupid!

SfPxs4OzKqBcxmkTidwjAQ.text: After a long day of climbing at Red Rocks, me and Megan were in search of some Mexican food and some margaritas.  While pissing everyone behind us off driving down West Charleston at 25 mph trying to read every restaurant sign looking for someplace to fill our requirements, I finally saw this free-standing little place and we promptly u-turned and headed back.  Inside was a cozy little place, well-cooled and comfortable.  Our waiter (I'm assuming Frank) came over with chips, salsa, and menus right away.  A+ on the chips and salsa.  An extensive menu (with all-day breakfast... which won Megans heart immediately) made our mouths start watering.  After waffling back and forth over the seemingly better and better choices, Megan finally settled on chicken soup & ropa vieja & I got the al pastor.  We also ordered some guacamole &, of course, margaritas to pass the time.  The guac & soup came out with some supplemental chips and damn were they tasty. Megans soup had large chunks of vegetables floating in it, and our waiter was happy to identify them all for us.  The guacamole was creamy and fresh and hit the spot after a day of dragging 30 lbs of gear through hot canyons.  Our plates came out shortly after... the ropa vieja was juicy as promised, and the al pastor had a great bite to it that really lingered on  the palate.  Frank & Fina's is now our de facto mexican go to place in Vegas.  It's close to the scenic loop in Red Rock Canyon, and still way off the strip.  We're looking forward to our next climbing trip so we can kick back at a more leisurely pace here (we were on our way to the airport after the meal) and really take our time enjoying a great meal in a very  friendly & inviting location.

IpbuXRoBlh60lBkCsknU2A.text: I put as much of a premium on service as I do on food; I won't go back to a place where the wait staff is inattentive or doesn't seem to care. Frank & Fina's has the perfect combination - outstanding food with outstanding service. It's slightly pricier than many Mexican restaurants in town but absolutely worth it. The food is authentic Mexican - no one at our table had even the slightest criticism about their meal, which almost never happens. The restaurant is convenient to anyone on the west side of Las Vegas, and the fact that it's just off the 215 Beltway makes it accessible for those in Henderson, too. A great place.

ALTTQKkA5yfYyMcXYpUbQg.text: I really love their food. The have the best chicken enchiladas I've tasted. Sometimes I'll go in there just for the chips and salsa. their salsa is so good. and also my all time favorite mexican desert, strawberry filled churro with ice cream.

zxTQ2jblBWQO5DbBuoR4rw.text: This is my favorite local sit-down mexican restaurant. I wish it was closer to my side of town. The new location is on W. Flamingo/i-215.  The  waiters are the best - always very friendly & attentive. The food is soooo good, very fresh & authentic. Everything I've tried has been wonderful, my favs. are enchiladas, beans & the breakfast plates. I always bring family/friends from out of town here & they all ask to come back when they visit.

4FpCJo9tYto5LIbAW-hCeQ.text: Great food here, fresh and hot. Good service, Try the Fajitas or grilled chicken. Never had a bad meal here.

UUEAcBuSTcQaOaBjWxUq5w.text: Great food for a great price!  Lovely atmosphere - a True gem!

xTsVlyX3J1nNWd0Do6jG4A.text: I love this little place because it is a small cozy place with GREAT mexican food. The nicest waiters and great tasting tortilla chips while you wait. There food was very fresh and piping hot. There refried beans were awesome. (I love refried beans!) and deep fried ice cream. Yum!

5RVoe-Bqe_-LfSIUenDXmQ.text: We love this restaurant for outstanding Mexican food.  The staff is always friendly and willing to accommodate special requests.  We have taken several visitors and a few locals here and it always becomes a quick favorite.  Good sized portions, fast service in a comfortable setting.

O-LeR47HIZzJXony-1pFUA.text: called in an order for chicken mole enchiladas, cheese enchilada with chicken tostada, and an order of flan. I was told it would be 20 minutes and when I showed up after more than 20 minutes I had to wait an additional 10 minutes for my order. The restaurant was not that busy. When I got home with my order they forgot my flan. I went back to the restaurant and the hostess knew exactly why I was there because she forgot the flan. I had to wait an additional 10 minutes while she seated another party and assisted another party with paying for their meal until I got the flan that she forgot. All I received was an apology and nothing else. No offer of a discount on my next visit or a discount on my order that I had placed. When I finally got home to enjoy my meal, it was mediocre at best. The mole was bland and anything less than good. it barely tasted like mole and more like thick gravy. The beans and rice we're nothing special and tasted like your run-of-the-mill Mexican fare. The best part was the pico de Gayo and cilantro. That was at least fresh and had the most flavor. Highly disappointed with my experience and not sure that I will ever return. Far better choices for Mexican food in the SW area. Additionally it was overpriced for what I received.

NruILDoxU_F0X9UoghR8rg.text: From the outside, it just looks like another strip mall eatery....inside it's very cute and cozy.  The margaritas, tortilla soup and fried ice cream was great!  After reading reviews about the other location and hearing about Sweet Potato Enchiladas, I had to try them.  I made my friend order them (haha) and they were definitely different...but good.  The prices were reasonable and the service was great.

zQ5QWo2NNicP4T4mznHzXA.text: Really, really good. Off the beaten path in a Target shopping area. GO!!!

RyCrwm3ynM5aVGIo_K1kpA.text: I absolutely love this place. The owner, Frank is a friendly guy who you can see occasionally serving tables and dishing out recommendations. Their food is authentic Mexican, not like those restaurant chains that claim to be. I enjoy their carnitas crunchy tacos and the chips and salsa. As a firm believer that the salsa says a lot about the food quality, you won't be disappointed. the prices are reasonable and service is great.

-sn-PVTVxIIVLhMd9xSslQ.text: Cannot believe I haven't reviewed this great mexican restaurant yet ... as my mind thinks of 3 things when I think of Frank & Fina's, and all three of them have "mole" in their name:  guacamole, mole (as in chicken enchiladas mole) and holy-mole sweet potato enchiladas!   (ok, not LOL funny..but you get my point!  Try these 3 items and you'll be back ... for more mole!     Ole'  (Misti your review inspired me ... as I've always tell people how great the sweet potato enchiladas are!  You must try next time!!)

DNhQws5iNOAZkdEP1yhXlA.text: Good food and excellent service! Nice atmosphere. Not the best mexican food, but tasty!

dcH6LDOSn_7ykhysojEcew.text: This has been my favorite Mexican restaurant for years.  Won't even consider any other Mexican restaurant.  The wait staff is superb, friendly and attentive. They remember you when you come back and don't hover over you and question you when your mouth is full.  My husband's favorites are their steak tips and chicken mole.  Both are delicious.  My favorite is the fajitas or the vegetable enchiladas.  I love their red sauce, it is not overpowering.  Their black beans are delicious, or you can get refried beans. The salsa has just the right kick and I can't get enough of it.  The quacamole is the best!  All in all a very cozy place with delicious food and friendly staff to help you.

TyaSoLx6NkeOrQvcbIGHWA.text: I had high expectations going on other yelps reviews and a waitress at Tacos & Tequila also recommended going.  The house margarita was only $5.75 and had a nice portion of tequila.  But the food was only above average and the prices were rather high considering it's a neighborhood restaurant.  Maybe I am too picky.  For less money, I would rather go to Super Mex.

QtTSwvIReUIGfbTXTBaejA.text: We returned because I wanted Tacos Al Pastor again. This time I ordered the Al Pastor plate (which is like 4 tacos?) and my boyfriend got the green chile something or other.   My al pastor was not nearly as good as my first review, it wasn't nearly as juicy and flavorful. However, my boyfriend was in love with his dish.    I am still keeping my 4 star score, and I will go back and order the al pastor!

es1Pafxjdek12qIzYE2ajw.text: This little eatery is a great find for those who want to enjoy non-chain restaurant.   The service was fast and accurate. The menu was moderately priced. And the options were decent enough to allow an experienced foodie to try something different.   The best part about this cocina is the quality. The food tasted fresh and tasty. I ordered the Chicken Mole Enchilada...it was delightful. I could taste the sweetness of the chocolate, the delicate bitterness of coffee, and a finish of light smoke. Looking forward to trying the fajitas next time.

fY0R7oBotQDmOt628STL2w.text: Such great food! The guacamole is awesome and you can get a half order. Everyone is very friendly and the service is stellar!!!  You definitely must try this place!

BGk0THJlkNHduF2fCJezYA.text: this restaurant is the best mexican place in nevada

MaepTUCDN5lClSod2VwNJg.text: I LOVE their crispy chicken tacos....it's the only thing I order when I go there. I just have one little comment...I wish they would cover up the glaring florescent light in the back of the original section of the restaurant (the side on the way to the restrooms). Hanging a couple of Mexican-style blankets from the ceiling would help - I cringe when I see the hostess heading that way to seat us specifically because of the harsh light there.

_6gHDV8oiJtkvEf9p3HMeA.text: When they first opened, we came here for their charbroiled chicken.  It was good but not memorable.  It's been a few years and we've haven't thought about the restaurant.  But tonight I came back because I was curious about the sweet potato enchiladas.    Wow, it was packed tonight.  We waiting 25 minutes for food and another 15 minutes before they took our order.  I ordered the sweet potato enchiladas and my hubby ordered the carnitas.   The sweet potato enchiladas were good but not out of this world great.  It must be all the vegetarians giving the great reviews for the sweet potato enchiladas. Don't get me wrong I love vegetarian food but this dish doesn't make me have that "ah" moment and "OMG" this so the best thing ever.    I would not order it again.  I would however order the carnitas.  I did my ninja move and sneak a fork full of yum yum roast pork from hubby's plate.  The pork was excellent.  It was tender and tasty.  I had some sour cream and salsa with the meat and made it into a 4 star dish.    Con-  My hubby thought the portion size was too small but I disagree.  It was perfect for me.

7d7tWZzrbhZV6PwGWvbhVw.text: Went here for Cinco de Mayo dinner.  Hostess told us the wait was about 45 minutes and I think we were seating in a little less than that.  However watching the bus staff, they definitely could have been a little quicker in turning over the tables.  They also don't have a bar to sit in while you wait; just a couple small benches at the entrance.  The atmosphere is nice and has a nice cantina feel to it.  Once we were seating, they brought the free chips and salsa immediately.  Guacamole is extra and was good (chunky and not watered down like a previous reviewer's was, so it may be hit or miss).  The owner roams around the restraurant and he brought us our food no more than 5 minutes after we ordered, as we simply ordered burritos and tacos.  I got the carne asada burrito enchilada style for around 10 bucks, and it was very good.  The best deal may be the tacos (2 a la carte for about $6).  The weak point at this place was the service.  After we got our food, our waiter all but disappeared  for at least a half an hour, leaving me wanting another margarita but not getting one.  Once they finally came around to take our plates away, I found myself thinking ahead "do we want more chips? another taco?" as I wasn't sure the next time we would get that chance.  A sign of poor service in my opinion.  Even as the place started to clear out and we were just sitting around talking, they didnt bring us our check until we were one of the last tables still there.  Overall, the food was tasty and I had an very enjoyable experience, mostly because of good company.  But I'm pretty sure we could of had that at a bunch of other places too.

fcx_1hj1Iy42sImYKin6YA.text: I've been coming to Frank and Finas for years now. Used to go to the old location on Charleston too. I had to review because I am surprised at all the negative service comments. Every time I have had great service, always fast and super friendly. Frank and his daughter are always helpful and on top of everything. Love the vegetarian items but my heart belongs to the shredded beef tacos and chile rellanos. It's surprisingly hard to find good Mexican food in Vegas and this place is consistently good. Still miss my LA Mexican joints though!

s9R2iy73Nv4LTJ6fs1TeGQ.text: My wife and I used to live nearby but we left Vegas about a year ago.  Every time we go back, we always make a special trip here because it is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.  My personal favorite is the Cochinita Pibil and my wife loves the Enchiladas Suizas.  Fantastic food and fantastic service.

LXc9xoMm8LwqjETRBhb_Fg.text: I've been to a lot of the Mexican places in town and this is by far the best. The service is always friendly and the prices are very reasonable. Their carnitas are probably the best I've had and their house habenero sauce is great. Ask for it when you go if you like the heat. The mole and chicken anything is great as well. Can't go wrong with anyone of the desserts either. This place is a must if you want good Mexican food. It blows away the local competition.

Tpq7CClQfF18Rv1xwWZ8WQ.text: We've been going to this place, and their previous restaurant on Charleston for years.  They have the best carne asada burrito, (enchilada style of course) in town.  They also make a great Mexican meatloaf when you can get it.  Finally, their fried ice-cream for dessert is the best!  Love this place!

pxFmSoUx4dgBQys8m3aFmw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant. The food and service are always the best!!

4ulJKk2zUSSSnldOs-7bvw.text: First I would like to say the food is phenomenal.  Second the service is the worst I have ever had in the ten years I have lived in Las Vegas.  The atmosphere is simply.  And there is nothing wrong with that.  The waiters are lazy. Everytime I decide to dine in they do not check on me unless it is to bring the check. It is never busy.  And I have seen the staff on their phones more than anything else. I suggest only purchasing take out from this place.  It may possibly be the best mexican in Las Vegas. The quality of food is superb.  But the front of house is horrendous.  I'm not even going to begin to describe what happened to me there tonight.  Truly I will never eat in at this restaurant I would rather order out and eat two doors down at samurai sams.

byIaDULvWrmUAlnmrwZfWQ.text: After years of being a faithful and loyal customer to Frank and Fina's Cocina, I had quite the appalling experience here which was one of my favorite local Mexican restaurants. I recently went in to share a quick meal with my mother. As it was a last minute get-together, I had eaten an hour before. We agreed I would enjoy chips and salsa along with Frank and Fina's delicious homemade guacamole, and my mother would have an entree. A nice man came to take our order. I have been served by him many times and never had any problem. He has always been polite and offered top level service. We ordered some guacamole and my mother ordered her entree. I respectfully told him I had recently eaten and was just going to snack on the appetizer while my mother had a full meal. He pressed me a little like any good salesman; offered me an ala carte enchilada. I expressed that it was tempting, but no thank you. He then told me that if we had the intention of sharing a plate that he would charge me an additional $3.00. While I found this a bit irritating, I obliged and said we would not be sharing and I would again, just be enjoying the appetizer. He put the order in and came back two minutes later. This time it got ridiculous. He asked me once more if I wanted to order an entree. I again said, "no thank you." He then looked me in the eye and said, verbatim, "if I see you touch her plate, I will charge you." I was appalled. Just when I thought he couldn't be any more condescending, he followed it up with, "do you understand me?" I was stunned. I asked for my check. I went to the counter to pay for my food. (The only thing we had at this point was the guacamole.) I asked the girl at the counter for his name. She told me he was the owner. I was in disbelief. I have never been treated so rudely. I have been coming to this establishment and singing its praises for over three years. This experience has ruined any chance of me or my family ever dining at this restaurant again. While I will admit that the food is good and usually the service is great, this encounter with the OWNER will never be forgotten.   My final thought is, "what would Fina have to say about Frank's behavior?"

esptez2rEWiLmldDisg3dQ.text: Frank and Fina's Cocina has a very good atmosphere in a very nice location.  The staff wasn't very friendly, but they weren't rude either.    The chips were good, light with a very satisfying crunch.  I found the salsa to be good, but not great.  It was simple and plain, with no spice.  I ordered the carnitas burrito, while my friend ordered the ropa vieja.  My burrito was, once again, good but not great.  He said he enjoyed his dish.  Nothing was over or undercooked, but everything seemed to be missing an extra kick.  I could understand where people would like this, but it wasn't up to my palate.  We finished the meal with fried ice cream, I've had better before, but it was still yummy.  Worth the try, but wouldn't go again. Sorry Frank and Fina!

zRwgY9rEpeiiO7Q_GOVMFQ.text: I think I just found a legit, good Mexican cuisine restaurant in Vegas!   I first discovered this place when I was invited with my girlfriends family about a month ago April 2015. Once walking in, the thought ran into my head, "this isn't going to be good." Call me picky, or whatever but Mexican cuisine restaurants in Vegas mostly miss the mark and taste bland. Sometimes I think they do it because it's easy, beans, rice and a burrito. Really?   I was recommend to try the chile relleno, something I wouldn't order normally, not because I don't like it more like there's other stuff that I like more. So took my girlfriends sisters recommendation and also heard it wasn't at all super spicy, and ordered the dish. My girlfriend (who cooks probably the best chicken enchiladas ever!) tried just that, chicken enchiladas with red sauce. She also tried something she normally wouldn't, and raved about how good it was. Had a taste, and indeed it was delicious. Nice balance of spice, not overpowering and the chicken was full of flavor. The rice, beans were also a nice addition since they somehow get it wrong at other restaurants.  Verdict, pretty good. The food tasted quite delicious and felt homemade. The chips with salsa aren't out of this world, but come on you have to have chips/salsa before your meal. I also added on the guacamole and if your sharing with say your friend or significant other, it'll do. It's good, not great, just nothing to complain.  The service was excellent. For a party of 9, they refilled our drinks took our order properly and had a professional demeanor.  Overall I liked it and was eager to revisit. So we did! Three weeks later.  Let me just say our second visit just the two of us was just as good, and might I say better! I didn't know they had Puerco Pibil! I got so excited since it's probably the most complex dish I ever created on my own, in my twenties, and was wondering how good would it taste.  People of Yelp, please try this dish! It's AMAZING!  Just the right amount of citrus and spice (not overly spicy) served with tortillas, rice and black beans! So so so so so good. Damn my stomach is rumbling.  This place will hopefully continue to surprise me as I try something different with every future visit.   The ambiance is perfect. You feel like your in someone kitchen, and they are whipping up some amazing Mexican food.  I give it 4 out of 5, just because I haven't tried most of the menu but it's promising enough to earn my business.

sWRJ4pAMv8mKnaOzyDlnNA.text: My favorite spot!  The best salsa ever and truly love when Frank has specials. It's a great way to try new things. Love the family atmosphere and intimate setting. My family's favorite is the grilled chicken salad with the house dressing. All the traditional plates are tasty and fresh. Hands down the best Mexican food in town...no need to go anywhere else.

vUEjtWwnreoh97SKpggpBg.text: Great chips and salsa, nachos and pork enchiladas.  I've been here 50+ times and will drive 25 minutes for It.  The staff is great too.

LUJR1Cx62TjBcdiocw8qWQ.text: This place was amazing. We started with the queso with pabalno chilies and chorizo, then chicken and beef taquitos, a chili relleno, then chili Verde and chili Colorado tamales, and steak ranchero . The sauce on the chili relleno omgosh so good. The salsa is the right amount of heat. The service was above and beyond awesome. I can't believe this isn't listed as the top Mexican place on vegas.

O-3NbqXkWlSkiZIFG_Wx0w.text: I ordered one of the day's specials - pork Veracruz.  It was tender, juicy, cubed pork loin with raisins, onions, olives, and tomatoes.  It was a great sauce and I wish I had some bread to sop up the juices left after everything was gone.  I finished it like I would any tasty broth.  Dessert was an order of cream filled churros.  They came with a side of ice cream drizzled with caramel and chocolate.  Delicious!  The restaurant is really a comfortable place.  Service was very good.  The man and woman helped each other and they were very pleasant and polite.  This was my first visit, but it won't be my last.  Make sure you check the specials board when you come in the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Out of focus cream filled churros.
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Veracruz.

WLGYfHnszOMMyY_uEmTUkg.text: The 1 star is not for the food, I love their food. The one star is for the managers lack of customer service!! I have worked in the food industry for several years and would think he would know that little gestures can go along way in making a customer happy.

oP3ZmznGqJWA6394CR55_g.text: Great food and service!!  New to Vegas and when I asked what the best place in town was they told me here!! I wasn't disappointed. Everything tastes so fresh!! We will be back!! There are so many things I want to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FsqCAGRU954kZBXZO2m5Og.text: Great Mexican Food.  I had one of the best Fajitas in my life here.  Excellent flavor steak and shrimp and the tortilla was amazing.  I also had a really good Patron Margerita!  Highly recommend this place and I can not wait to go back.

AkegfbUgruIO-rL3VwRAPA.text: The food was the bomb! We came in Fourth of July and they were supper busy, but they managed to take good care of us. I only saw 2 waitresses but the bust boy hooked us up! He came back many times to offer us more chips, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KOuyY7QycxNMprib9UNZzQ.text: The best Mexican food in the Las Vegas Valley! Their salsa is to die for and the family owned restaurant is just amazing. Adrian is the son of the owners and he is so wonderful accommodating kind and walks around and talks to everybody and works his butt off! Go check it out!!!

EVdMyHu5AH-F1cxZxtRQ1g.text: Love the mom and pop vibe and the food is delicious!! Best place to bring family and friends and fulfill my Mexican food fix!! The family that owns this restaurant is the nicest best people I've ever met and couldn't ask for anything more!

biu8WLAvsVw6xoTEOi4pmA.text: This is a great place for some Mexican food, which is not my usual hole int he wall restaurant. Came here with 2 of my clients and the food did not disappoint me The Cochinita Pibil is amazing, and so are the fajitas. The atmosphere is clean and the staff are very nice.

AmFG2hCpj6arTlH2NWZAEg.text: We have been talking about visiting this place for a while now and I'm glad we finally stopped in. We had a great meal and genuinely friendly and attentive service. The tamales tasted fresh and wonderfully seasoned. I also loved the happy hour sliders. The balance of all the flavors were absolute perfection. The bread was flavorful and crisp. The meat had the perfect seasoning and savoriness that worked well with the pickled vegetables and guacamole. The tacos, to me, were just okay. Other than that, everything was very tasty so we'll definitely be back again soon.
