Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

ZnYfnQAcFe-xV_4qzmdt5A.text: Been going to Frank And Finas for close to 20 years, 30 years if you include Alberto's where Frank got his start. Everything is fresh and on point. My go to dishes are Mole' Enchiladas, Cochanita Pibil (Marinated pork;  a popular Yucatan dish), Chile Verde and of course classic Chicken tacos. The salsa is amazing and don't leave without trying a tamarindo Margarita. Only negative is they stopped serving the coconut ice cream (bring it back please) F&F the best on the westside!

LWNlhz3vY0hJGoNM-EOysA.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. The staff always are so friendly, food is to die for! I think they need to bottle and sell their salsa! It is just the best...and their daily specials, always something exciting to try! What makes this restaurant stand above is the homemade food and excellent staff! Thank you for all you do! Love you guys!

KpzBe41PYL9ozE43s7AVVQ.text: Very good food! Love the decor and the food! It reminds me most of original Mexican places in NM. Employees are always kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tampiquena. It&#39;s so delicious!! Rice, beans, ribeye, cheese enchilada n guacamole.
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips n salsa

T2LKadBl-3y0Xs3nLdS9Gg.text: Had a carne Asada chimichanga. Pretty. Damn good, and good service. Black beans tasted very processed and milky, but the rest of the meal was awesome. Highly recommended.

793Z-RZ_i-1aFvnNTrehfw.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I used to go to W. Charleston location back in the 90's. Now they moved to my side of town and i couldn't be happier.

1lMt0qLS6UXT-vruCz2zAA.text: This is a very cute restaurant, but we did not enjoy the food at all. The chips and salsa was the only thing we liked. We ordered fajitas with rice and beans. The rice was not good some pieces of the rice was hard. The service was kinda a slow, we only saw the waitress twice. Just very disappointing!

M_sM_1xg7lNcqsOudyAvJg.text: I know there are many Mexican restaurants around town, but this is my favorite restaurant.  Especially chicken verde!  Wow, to die for! Great flavor!  You will always get great consistency in quality of food and service here!

BftE5YNr6ql_ojcc8SPaVw.text: Great food, service, and price! However,  I was disappointed on my last visit. I had family in town, who are in the military, and they simply asked if they had a military discount.  The server wasn't sure,  so he asked the manager who said "no."  No problem!  Thanks for asking! But that wasn't the end of it. The manager (possible owner) comes over & gives this huge long story about how his prices are so low,  they can't afford to give any more of a discount.  "Where else can you go and have 4 people eat lunch for $40?" Everything was great until he had to come over and justify why he doesn't give a military discount.  It was completely unnecessary!!  Next time,  we'll take our business elsewhere when we're in the mood for Mexican food.

oyJl3sLUE-buwgJXN05ZNg.text: This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas and we are glad we found our new favorite place for Mexican food. We are definitely coming back and bringing friends & family when they come to town.   We ordered the char - broiled chicken which reminded me of my mom's barbecue back home. We also had the 2 green Chile pork enchiladas. Did I mention the delicious chips & salsa you get once you get seated.  BTW, service was excellent. From the hostess to busser & our waiter was very friendly & informative.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Char - broiled chicken
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two green Chile pork enchiladas

6TIqsXD-o1KDdLVuo14izg.text: This place is awesome. The service was fast and friendly and the Mole is the best I have ever had. Totally worth the ride from Henderson.

VsaDgxefA43S3xqDXi9p3A.text: This is our second visit and both my wife and I have decided that Frank and Fina's has taken over 1st place in our Mexican food restaurant preference.     We have been here for both dinner and now lunch.  Both times we have received excellent service, high quality and diverse menu options, and to our satisfaction, the best chips and salsa beginnings to our meals.  For dinner, I had the chicken bomba and it was very flavorful with a slight twist on the traditional chicken fajita dish.  The bomba comes with mushrooms, red and green peppers, cheese and all the traditional fixings.    The lunch taco plate was perfectly balanced components and just the right amount of food.    My wife had the beef enchilada plate for dinner and liked it so well she ordered it again for lunch on this visit.  We will keep coming back and recommend this place highly!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas with mushrooms and rice and beans
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Ground beef enchiladas with rice and beans

o4iMHsQBdRf_AfDdasPxWQ.text: I used to eat here quite often.  But no more it is obvious they are now using MSG in their food, lots of MSG.  I have asthma and I am very sensitive to MSG.  Within 20 minutes of eating I developed MSG symptoms which did not go away for almost 48 hours.

X5qFjVIe5gSF_AurMFvcsg.text: Another great meal. Such nice people and the staff is so attentive. Reasonably price delicious food. The bean and queso dip to start along with their house salsa. For the entrees chicken Nolan, chili Colorado and steak with grilled onions and jalapenos. Nice variety of authentic Mexican food. We really enjoyed our experience. And we have been coming here from the beginning when the restaurant was only half the size.  Nice to see a great place with staying power.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frijoles and queso dip to start with delicious house made salsa and very thin crispy tortilla chips

Sg8xunlX5QzeCnrSeh2Z4w.text: Stopped for lunch with our four kids. Everyone happy and full! Service welcoming and thorough.

X2dxl3PokdE6LDQUXDHKwA.text: This is a really cute place with tasty Mexican food and a cozy feel. My friend and I came in around 8 on a weeknight - it was still busy! That's a good sign, and when we were seated immediately, I knew it was going to be a good experience, and it was.  The salsa is yummy- not very spicy but a really good flavor. Our food came out pretty quickly - one of my tacos had cotija cheese on it, which I had asked them to replace with regular cheese, but our server took it away immediately and came back quickly with a replacement. I ordered a taco and an enchilada with rice and beans - the taco was good, but the enchilada was really delicious! Next time I'll probably just go with enchiladas only. I love their enchilada sauce. Their beans and rice were a little lacking in flavor, but were still good and I enjoyed my dinner. I was a little under the weather, and I really appreciated the good service we received - I was downing glasses of water quickly and the staff made sure I always had a full glass.  My friend ordered a taco al pastor and thought it was good, but was put off by pineapples in the taco. I'm not sure if it was specified in the menu, so if not, just be aware.   I just moved back to Vegas and I'm trying everything out, but I could definitely see myself coming back to Frank and Fina's - the food and service were good, and I really enjoyed the atmosphere.

Ifb6Vpj6wsdviyTdu0IIeQ.text: The family was back in Vegas over 4th of July weekend, and so we had to come back to Frank & Fina's for some authentic Mexican, and man they didn't disappoint, at all!  Last year we visited on 4th of July, this year we visited a couple days before the 4th, thinking it would be less full, and boy were we wrong! It was actually packed (and for a very good reason!). Fortunately, we were seated immediately upon getting there, and were delighted to see that a couple of the waitresses recognized us from our previous trip, welcoming us back.  You can't come to F&F's and not order the Empanadas appetizer! You just can't! Four beef/cheese filled turnovers, that taste awesome paired with the chipotle ranch dip that comes with them! Hands down their signature appetizer!  On this particular visit, we were fortunate that the house specials of the day included Spinach Tamales (pictured). While I didn't taste them, pops and moms each had one and they both loved the taste and texture of it. Moms wasn't expecting it to taste great, but the seasoning of the spinach won her over. Being a vegetarian, she often complaints that there isn't much great tasting vegetarian fare these days at restaurants. She kept complementing how great the tamale tasted and pops echoed her sentiment. A first, since we're used to tamales with pork/chicken/dulce, but never one made of spinach. Kudos for the great idea to the folks at F&F's!  Myself, I was hungry and so I had the Shrimp al Mojo de Ajo and the Al pastor burrito. The servings here are always generous, and so I skipped on the beans/rice and gave those to my parents, and I just went in on the shrimp and the burrito. It was my first time tasting the Al pastor burrito here, and I am glad I did. It is now one of my favorite dishes here at F&F's. The meat tender, cooked to perfection, and the Al pastor flavoring just perfect, not too heavy, not too lean. The Shrimp were also great tasting and plentiful. It took well over an hour, but managed to finish my entree LOL  Overall, service was great as always (And who doesn't appreciate when the wait staff actually remembers you from a year ago?). That is truly an awesome thing. So far, we are 2/2 with F&F's and have made it our favorite Vegas Mexican restaurant. We shall return in the fall again!  Until then, happy adventures folks!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three entrees... All great!
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The house menu of the day...
Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas

OvtOh-NPyt6TTU8GTDMtdQ.text: Came here at 2:50p for lunch, only one here... ordered the lunch special, the enchilada, also ordered the chicken tortilla soup.  chips and salsa good, chicken tortilla soup ok, rest was average. Not exactly a memorable experience, but I'd come back for the chips and salsa and a drink.

0b5WFsqdvnkj_bd2vNjSSw.text: The service here was excellent and for that reason I'll be back.   As far as the food, the quality was good but it didn't hit a bullseye for me. The salsa tasted a bit like spaghetti sauce, the Fideo had very think spaghetti line noodles rather than the thin.. Little weird but good flavor. The chile verde was excellent, the beans and rice were just ok. Lunch specials give you a ton of food, great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Fina's Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde

w4SFvu05yqwxFW8CgtyVcQ.text: I don't often get to that side of town but the trip for good Mexican food is worth it. The grilled salmon tacos are awesome and the margaritas are the best in town. Family owned and ran. Great food and service.

VwBaIQRp5WF3vQgf-yEh0A.text: We were planning on dining in our hotel with take-out from another Mexican restaurant.  We weren't PHAST enough though as they closed up shop at 7p.  This led us to Frank & FIna's quite by accident, but what a wonderful accident it was!  AMBIANCE:  EXCELLENT.  The lighting was low and the art was appealing.  There were plenty of tables to assure that we didn't have a wait, but were spaced out enough so that no one felt crowded.  SERVICE:  EXCELLENT.  The staff there were friendly and quick to assist us.  Our server checked back with us often but was not overbearing.  Our food was hot, delivered promptly and our drinks were always filled.  FOOD:  VERY GOOD.  The chips were excellent.   The salsa did have a thick tomato taste (almost ketchup-like) but had just enough kick to appeal to everyone.  We certainly didn't hesitate to polish off the bowl.  Other dishes we tried were the Carne Asada Burrito and nachos.  We found all to be very tasty.  The only criticism was on the amount of cheese on the nachos.  It was VERY thick, masking the other flavors too much.  OVERALL:  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town and craving good Mexican cuisine.

MG0kIQE0gBwphfyj9KyHlA.text: We love this place!!  Best Mexican we've found in town!!  Friendly service, great food, cozy atmosphere.

d698XBQrUBfX6MpvI4MOlA.text: The last time we went here my mother got a pube in her food, yes a pube. Not only did she have a pube in her food but when she informed the manager his reaction was basically what do you want me to do about it oh well. After such a terrible experience and quite frankly terrible food I will never be returning

4Cu5p9DZPg9Mtdxei-kVWA.text: Very good, pork meat is amazing. Loved the pork tacos. Guacamole is also great. Found those to be the exceptional part of my meal. Everything else was good though and what you would expect from a traditional sit down Mexican restaurant.

wtd2JGBwewXph4Rvo30g2g.text: What a gem!  Delicious Yucatan food with items on the menu such as panuchos, cochinita pibl, mole and motelenos!  A few people at oir table had the panuchos and we all loved it!

6NP6IUq2RtkFB-X5AGh8Kg.text: When my husband and I moved to Las Vegas, we were staying at the hotel across the street. One night we decided to give it a try and we loved it. The food, customer service, and atmosphere was great. They serve you good portions and the prices are reasonable.

_AQV9DMImLu40ub-ICUtpg.text: We eat here frequently and it's always good. The nightly specials are unique & delicious and there is always a vegetarian special as well as several vegetarian entrees on the regular menu. And yes, plenty of meat for the carnivores also! Don't forget cocktails & sopapillas for dessert. Great spot for a date or just a relaxing dinner with family.

f0urNstMKL7nT8qMui3Hqg.text: I've been here 3.5 years and this is the best Mexican food I've found in Vegas.  I'm still looking for the PERFECT place, but this is pretty damn good.  A friend of mine, who is Mexican, said this is his favorite place and his wife won't eat anywhere else, so we met another friend there for lunch.  Our friend enjoyed his taquitos a great deal.  I loved the salsa!!  Very tasty and spicy enough.  The chips are homemade and a little thick for me, but they were great.  My cheese enchiladas were over the moon!  I think they would be better if they had some onions in them, but that could be just me.  A SOLID 4-star experience. Great staff, tasty chow.  Just go!

h-RJBpFdwCrgUrlS2kw8qg.text: I wish there's a 3.5 star option.  The food and service were good, but nothing was special enough for me want to go back.  The Chili Relleno was kinda disappointing.  The pork dishes were tasty.  It must be hard for Mexican restaurants to stand out because of the massive competition.

tgE7ONsygVa_7YNA6FZ2bQ.text: Frank & Fina's Cocina remains a consistent dinner choice for me.  I've been branching out from my usual order, and trying to experience more of the menu.  I recently discovered a new favorite:  Machaca Burrito -  I didn't realize how insanely delicious Machaca was, and how fun it is to say....MACHAAAACAAA!!  It's marinated and shredded beef with eggs, and it wants to get to know you.  They do a great  Machaca here, keeping it tender and tasty.  This is the best Mexican cuisine in Spring Valley.  MACHAAAACCAAA!!

Lh8VsFxg0z1hqTegPJv6SA.text: This is our favorite Mexican place. Love their sweet potato enchiladas. Food always comes out quickly and delicious. Service is good!

0z1jbgj5GagycSEVIeOLug.text: Always great food. Family like atmosphere. I love the chips and salsa. And the margaritas!  And the enchiladas!  I loved it all.

lc6nfM8ivlequDzMAMqs2Q.text: Fire is all i can say carna asada burrito enchilada style is amazing salsa is great and service always friendly and quick never disappoints in the 10+ times I've been!!!

2ff8098v1G-74M9019VBlg.text: Went here for dinner Saturday night. Very nice place. We were greeted at the door, shown to our table. Within seconds we had salsa and chips. our server was great. Brought our drinks quickly. the salsa was a little to hot and spicy for me, the chips were fresh. We ordered bean dip which was very good. I liked the touch of the red onion. It was a small amount and not overwhelming.  I ordered the charbroiled chicken. BF had the sweet potato enchilada. Both meals were excellent.  We will be dining here again. Really enjoyed our meal.

jHE2ScWN9ZNyHVCBCNiW-g.text: Clean and fresh Mexican food....definitely in my top ten of fave restaurants of all time.  Service is always great as well as the ambiance.  I love this restaurant.

hPZ_W8H3qiBQMlTY3zLYcQ.text: Service was very good. They have awesome pork carnitas! Great flavor. I had the torta. Flavor was nice. My only complaint was it was a little on the small side, just a little:-) their salsa is also very good with the house chips. My friend got the chicken nachos and liked them. Portion for the nachos was HUGE! Very nice place and atmosphere. Check it out!

ndMQ5buqJHJfyKl5SG2LxQ.text: Very rude staff. You walk in and the place is completely empty absolutely no ambiance lightening is dark and depressing. We tell the waiter we would like to share an entree and he proceed to explain there will be a $3 charge ??? Hello am i at the Wynn Buffett ??? Food was bland definitely not authentic Mexican food. Not a fan

AhFcl_UunObgCoMlFXcxrw.text: Must have hit it on a bad night. Super bummed with the service and the food. The black bean display is quite odd and I ordered a 15 dollar shrimp dish that left me wondering what id just ate. Beautiful decor and authentic vibes, the food just flopped. We had four different servers, one for drinks one took our food order, one brought the food and one server once I stared and tried to make eye contact refilled my water. I love supporting small places, family places and rly dislike leaving less than stellar reviews, especially one w such great ones. I wanted to love my dinner and rave about it, instead I write this as my disappointment was that big.

bn8qotEjpUaNIIysRngVrw.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas. I have been going here for years the owner is amazing and the severs is great along with a great menus. The salsa is so tasty. It's a must if your looking for good Mexican food with good prices

WcmvWCa66W99nF4FHuvr3w.text: Wife and I had a craving for Mexican food for lunch today so we decided to try Frank & Fina's which we'd noticed on a couple of occasions while in the area. The restaurant is quite attractive, much better than you'd expect from the exterior.  We ordered a nachos to share and I ordered carne asada tacos and carnitas tacos, both in soft corn tortillas.  The first thing that arrived were the chips and salsa - I see a lot of love for their salsa on Yelp, however I found it tasted almost exactly like "Diablo" style pasta sauce and every bite sent me flashing back to the last time I lazily poured half a jar of the stuff over a plate full of hastily prepared rigatoni. Chips were good and the salsa was clearly prepared with care, just not to my taste at all.  The nachos were quite light and pleasant and provided a nice grazing option while waiting for our meals.  When the tacos arrived I was pleased. The carnitas were delicious and crispy in parts and the asada was cooked to delicious perfection. About the only improvement I could suggest for these tacos would be some element to combat them being just a tiny bit dry, perhaps some guacamole or sour cream as standard. Luckily I had some left over with the nachos and this complimented them well.  Service was great throughout and overall I really enjoyed my meal here.

m2MbU1hOltYPaJs9dz8nvQ.text: We eat at Frank & Fina's at least monthly for the last few years. The service, food, and price are unbeatable. Veronica is always such a pleasure to have as a waitress. She is very friendly and recommends the most delicious dishes. My personal favorite is the shredded beef crispy tacos. My partner loves the sweet potatoes enchiladas and empanadas. We don't just feel like customers when we eat there. Veronica makes us feel right at home knowing what we like to drink and food favorites. I would recommend everyone eat there at least once. After just that one time you are guaranteed to want to return frequently like we do.

xZQdoxQ6uFcYY6yPKFvtDA.text: This little treasure was somewhat hidden in the Grand Canyon Shops that contain Sears, Target, and Kohls.  I knew of the other restaurants around there including Fudruckers but for some reason had passed over this diamond.   My friend was the one who took me here and lauded the food with praise.  She wasn't fibbing.  The decor is quaint and has a very warm and coyz feel, almost like you were stepping into an older cantina or as a friend I recently took there suggested, it is reminiscent of Old Town in San Deigo.    The servers are alwasy very friendly and described the items on the menu like you could taste them.   On my most recent trip, my party had the steak and shrimp fajita, a shredded beef dish, and I had the delectable tilapia fish tacos.  We all took tastes of each other's dishes.  I will say that the steak was not bad but not as fantastic in comparision to our other offerings.  The salsa and chips were fantastic and had just the right kick.  The queso appetizer was also very good although a little too thick in consistency to my liking, the others in my party ate it up with great delight.  The Tilapia tacos were the hands down winner.  My friend exclaimed that it was the best fish taco she had ever had even topping the ones she had at the Laughing Marlin in Mazatlan ( a hard act to follow no doubt).    My other friend was from Mexico and he said that the food was very authentic and everything was very comforting and delicious.

cW2T9OvrOlxJY4Af3RtenQ.text: Seriously, what is with all the hype?!?!? We got lousy service and our food was gross. I am not at all a picky eater but their mole tasted like somebody just mixed in yesterday's burnt coffee over some chicken and tortillas and called it a day.  Keep searching yelpers, I'm sure there is better out their in Las Vegas.

QxB-VYqryuWlAXIkAtCEuQ.text: If I could give 0 stars I would this place got me ill from their shrimp also the service SUCKED with a capital SSSSS ..  and they waited on like 5 other tables before us and we were seated first I think they might have been racist which doesn't surprise me or the old man who runs this joint needs to hang up the apron and let the young bucks handle the waitressing it wouldn't matter though because the tasteless subpar salsa and greasy chips wouldn't be worth coming in for anyway

X6sUhKjklUThXN1COhCSFQ.text: My favorite mexican food in town. They original location on charleston was closed and they moved to this location about 7 years ago.  Food is high quality.

pZkOxs_PpoCWwJZoCQ67-Q.text: After an afternoon of Target, Kohl's and Sears my husband was ready for his well deserved margarita. We headed to Frank & Fina's Cocina which we had stumbled upon during our previous shopping extravaganza.   We were seated right away, despite the fact it was a hoppin Saturday night! Drink and chips were served very promptly by a friendly server. The margaritas were excellent and perfect ratio of alcohol to mixers.  We ordered a few plates and ate them "family style" We had a Relleno, Mole Enchiladas and Carnitas Tacos. Yum, yum and yum. 100% satisfaction with all dishes. This has quickly moved up to my #1 "everyday" Mexican restaurant. I can't wait to come back and try more menu items.   Fresh ingredients, full of flavor, reasonable prices. SOLD!

tgluRhFsw9SB-A8KmxEHUQ.text: We went here for lunch on a Sunday. A lot slower than it was for a Friday night dinner, which was nice. It also meant we had fantastic service, and we got our food right away and didn't eat our weight in chips and amazing salsa. My wife got the tacos as she did the last time, and was very pleased. I had the veggie taquitos, which were incredible. They were filled with potatoes, sweet potatoes, squash and zucchini. They were fried, but didn't have the grease dripping out of them like you can find elsewhere. They came with sour cream and a very good guacamole, which were nice additions to the meal.  I definitely preferred the food this time around, probably because we didn't wait long and it was super fresh.

5VVsuu0EtnvNX9KZu5uElg.text: Bland food, inattentive service.  An upstate New Yorker recommended this place; I don't think they have eaten a lot of Mexican food.  I would take seniors here who do not care if their food tastes good.  It was not bad food, just bland food.

AjRBI2S0i9g4-D63M0du2Q.text: Had dinner there this week, very good food, best I have had since socal, cute restaurant, waiter was super friendly.  Chips Salsa and Guacamole were all very good and the Tamale was quite tasty, reminded me of being home in Socal with all the great mexican restaurants.  Good food, good place, go visit!

uEMeGAJEmMmmjRrdcGgQBg.text: We don't usually write reviews, but tonight I felt obligated. Everything was to perfection. I took Frank's recommendation for panuchos while my wife enjoyed the simplicity of a bean and cheese burrito. The ingredients were very fresh and Frank served us with the utmost care. We've been here a bunch of times, going back to the original location on Charleston, and it just seems to get better each time.   Nothing bad to say. Thanks Frank. We'll be back.

_Jdps5nYGVeNl0_kwwe6-A.text: I made reservations on cinco de mayo and was surprised the could even accommodate a party of 5. Although there was a wait outside we were seated immediately. The service was extremely slow and inattentive. The food and just meh...I also got the sweet potato enchiladas and really didnt think they were anything special. I would give it one more chance to see if anything is work going back for. For now i just want to move on to the next review and not wast my time with this mediocre resturant.

Mbmhg-jG2s0Fb1WTkEVHoQ.text: Went here about 6 weeks ago, just getting around to posting a review.  Overall the food was pretty good.  Maybe nostalgic memories of them over on Charleston and Lindell are leaving me just a little dissatisfied.  I gotta wonder if the memory of food establishments from 20 years ago is really a good comparison for their current product offerings.

DzH8DlhrH7_nFSAfy-zXXw.text: This restaurant is wonderful.  I have been eating there for years (When they were on Charleston).  The Queso Fundido is my favorite.  Overall the atmosphere is good and the food is great!

Y30HnTj0rbCsjZuQfZlu0A.text: Very good food, consistant. Could use more ambiance. Staff is freindly and professional. Salsa excellent.

XzbWbLOOVTS-AzWCJKxP2g.text: Basically a solid Mexican restaurant, decent prices, good food. Only complaint is the salsa is very mild, but if you ask them for some hot sauce they will give you some really spicy stuff. Mix it in with the salsa and it tastes much much better. I like the Chicken Fajitas as an Entree.

3I_4C8hQfrhmLHRrfMR-Bw.text: Best Mexican Food we've ever had, and we've been to many. We go there very often. Prices very reasonable, service is great and the food is just AMAZING.

1E-Mqv5mrz2cYo62gSatGA.text: Quite possibly THE BEST Mexican Cuisine in Las Vegas! My favorite spot for sure! The staff is wonderful, the food comes out quick, hot, delicious, and AUTHENTIC. Being from Spanish decent, everything I have tried on the menu, so far, has impressed me!! Being from out of town, I always stop by this place when I'm in Vegas. See you tomorrow :)

0YnauR-RyR2MbQaoo5SRKw.text: Went for my birthday after all the great reviews. Service was great but food only ok. I had the guacamole and chips to start and sweet potato enchiladas good but not great. I'd be willing to go back if someone else wanted to go here but I am not planning on going back.

mUYNgyTeqBhqFDYy42XMCQ.text: Muy muuuuyy bien! I'm going to say that Frank & Fina's is the best mexican restaurant in town (well...on the west side of the strip). I absolutely love this place. The tortilla chips and salsa are fresh, the food is amazing and the servers are very friendly. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, my favorite is the carnitas tacos. Juicy, crispy pork on fresh corn tortillas. It's a small location in summerlin and perfect for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Five stars. Go try it.

AYzCKfrHJC9PkM7bqcLG2A.text: Always outstanding. Brett loves the pork -- but today it's "conference call tacos."

UOpRcmwaz4PfkUZr5C8S7A.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant by far! The staff is really friendly and the food is so good. Definitely recommended if you are in the area.

xYOQTtGv3TPeI6LXlvlPiQ.text: Being from San Diego we are always looking for great Mexican food.  This place was excellent.  Atmosphere, service, food.  Thanks Yelp! for recommending this place.  We'll return next time we are in Vegas.

Ei2DjOMlGBGgpjYGtYK9pw.text: Loved the old location with Frank always stopping by talking to us.  Second time at this location and service not so good.  The ice tea is great and love the salsa.  Always good choice with the chili rellenos. Rest of friends liked the food they ordered.

cSxImp_7kZtCmQr3ayyW_g.text: I can't praise them enough! We had some important friends in town who were  more than 3000mi away from home. Their one request was some good Mexican food and Frank & Fina's is The Best.  The ambiance was perfect, clean, cozy but not cramped.  The service was perfect.  We had an unusually loud group and everyone was so kind and patient. We were delivered chips and salsa before we even finished sitting down. They're so great!  One thing that genuinely impressed me was the way he took time to tell us about some of their specials and their specialties the way a formal restaurant does. He has a way of making you love the food before you even know what to order. It was great!  Everyone ordered something different, and everyone LOVED the food. I'm dying to go back asap!  I'm pretty sure I will dream of their mole enchiladas until I do. The price was HALF what I was expecting it was going to be, and that included drinks. You can't beat that!  Epic food, epic service, all affordable.

KGLpapzPvImpHyFToBBBEQ.text: While exploring around Vegas on our recent trip we stopped by this great place for a bite to eat. It was highly recommened to us by friends and  we had to try it out for ourselves. The chicken enchiladas and rice and beans were great along with the steak burrito. The churros I must say were quiet delicious. I would definately come back again when I'm in the area. The prices were quiet reasonable also. Good experience.

HsQzTmiYoaDJik-9UPIZHg.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. The food is always consistent and very reasonably priced. The complimentary chips and salsa is always good. The chips are not greasy and the salsa is not too spicy, but flavorful. The menu items can be found at any typical Mexican restaurant. We always get the chicken or carnitas burrito served enchilada style. The meat is always very tasty and the rice and beans are prepared accordingly. Other items I have tried include, green chile pork and taquitos. Both are very good.   The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere very Southwest looking. The staff is always friendly and efficient. I started going to Frank & Fina's a few years ago when it was a smaller 15-ish table restaurant. They have since taken over the space next door and doubled the size of the dining room.  You have to assume that the quality and value that they have has generated a loyal following who have recommended it to others. I know I have recommended it to some friends who now dine here regularly as well.

71WhCNb7a_A73NFRHlD2HA.text: food and service are great! family run business makes you feel like your part of the family too. chef specials are always creative and very good.

PvRwLl46Q9G0OGFHrfRo0g.text: This is an update from my last review of 5 stars May 2012. The chicken enchildadas and tamales was tasteless. The refried beans were watered down; apparent in its appearance substantiated by its taste. The chicken mole was also lacking in flavor. We won't be returning; especially since there are so many other better restaurants with new ones cropping up continuously.
